Mary Wolcott of Windsor CT

2nd daughter of Henry and Elizabeth Wolcott of Windsor CT.

Revised January 2026
These web pages are intended for genealogical research purposes only and may not be used elsewhere without permission, but linking is allowed without need of approval. Questions and additions or corrections may be sent to Eric Wolcott, (ewolcott6 at gmail.com).
(1) Mary Wolcott (), b. ABT 1622 Tolland, Somerset, England, d. 16 SEP 1689 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesMARY came to America with her sister and younger brother about 1635. She and her husband died the same day.
m. 25 JUN 1646 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Job Drake , b. 1619 Wiscombe, Devonshire, England, d. 16 SEP 1689 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
7 children: Abigail, Mary, Job, Elizabeth, Joseph, Hepzibah, Hester "Esther".
(2) Abigail Drake (Mary Wolcott1), b. 28 SEP 1648 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 17 NOV 1696 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. 20 AUG 1668 Northampton, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts, Israel Dewey , b. 25 SEP 1645 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 23 OCT 1678 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
4 children: Hannah, Israel, David, Joseph.
(3) Hannah Dewey (Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1680 Westfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. .
m. 1704 Westfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, Philip Loomis , b. 22 FEB 1675 Westfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 1 DEC 1746 Simsbury, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
12 children: Hannah, Philip, Joel, Elizabeth, Abigail, Mary, Jerusha, Timothy, Margaret, Sarah, Ruth, Prudence.
(4) Hannah Loomis (Hannah Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 21 MAY 1705 Westfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. ,, Connecticut.
m. 25 JUN 1730 ,, Connecticut, Azariah Holcomb , b. 1707 Westfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 1771 Granby, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
10 children: Benjamin, Abner, Elizabeth, Eldad, Obed, Hannah, Bethia, Mary, Lois, Eunice.
(5) Benjamin Holcomb (Hannah Loomis4, Hannah Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 3 MAR 1746 Simsbury, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. Elizabethtown, Herkimer Co., New York.
m. Mercy Kendall , b. 18 JAN 1748 Woburn, Middlesex Co., Massachusetts, d. .
1 children: Mehitable.
(6) Mehitable Holcomb (Benjamin Holcomb5, Hannah Loomis4, Hannah Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1768 Panton, Addison Co., Vermont, d. .
m. Darius Holcomb , b. 1754 Panton, Addison Co., Vermont, d. .
4 children: Henry Albert, Laura, Sarah, Harriett.
(7) Henry Albert Holcomb (Mehitable Holcomb6, Benjamin Holcomb5, Hannah Loomis4, Hannah Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 30 DEC 1786 Arlington, Bennington Co., Vermont, d. .
(7) Laura Holcomb (Mehitable Holcomb6, Benjamin Holcomb5, Hannah Loomis4, Hannah Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1788 Arlington, Bennington Co., Vermont, d. .

m. 1816 James Harpham , b. ABT 1788 Arlington, Bennington Co., Vermont, d. 1817 .
(7) Sarah Holcomb (Mehitable Holcomb6, Benjamin Holcomb5, Hannah Loomis4, Hannah Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 DEC 1792 Arlington, Bennington Co., Vermont, d. 22 MAY 1874 Centerville, Montgomery Co., Ohio.
m. 1821 Xenia, Greene Co., Ohio, James Popenoe , b. 20 AUG 1777 Morgantown, Monongalia Co., West Virginia, d. 19 AUG 1848 Centerville, Montgomery Co., Ohio.
7 children: Presley Martin, Judson, Willis Parkison, Albert Gallatin, Martha Jane, John Newton, Harriet.
(8) Presley Martin Popenoe (Sarah Holcomb7, Mehitable Holcomb6, Benjamin Holcomb5, Hannah Loomis4, Hannah Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 NOV 1822 Xenia, Greene Co., Ohio, d. 1853 Morning Sun, Louisa Co., Iowa.1 children: Presley Martin.
(9) Presley Martin Popenoe (Presley Martin Popenoe8, Sarah Holcomb7, Mehitable Holcomb6, Benjamin Holcomb5, Hannah Loomis4, Hannah Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1848 Xenia, Greene Co., Ohio, d. 10 DEC 1885 Silver City, Grant Co., New Mexico.
(8) Judson Popenoe (Sarah Holcomb7, Mehitable Holcomb6, Benjamin Holcomb5, Hannah Loomis4, Hannah Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 APR 1824 Xenia, Greene Co., Ohio, d. JAN 1873 .
m. 17 OCT 1854 Elizabeth Ewing , b. ABT 1828 Xenia, Greene Co., Ohio, d. .

m. 21 OCT 1851 Springfield, Sangamon Co., Illinois, Marinda Holcomb , b. 28 JAN 1827 , Greene Co., Ohio, d. 1 DEC 1914 Altadena, Los Angeles Co., California.
6 children: Edwin Alonzo, Lucy, Willis Parkison, Charles, Fred Oliver, Harry.
(9) Edwin Alonzo Popenoe (Willis Parkison Popenoe8, Sarah Holcomb7, Mehitable Holcomb6, Benjamin Holcomb5, Hannah Loomis4, Hannah Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 JUL 1853 Xenia, Greene Co., Ohio, d. 18 NOV 1913 Topeka, Shawnee Co., Kansas.

(8) Albert Gallatin Popenoe (Sarah Holcomb7, Mehitable Holcomb6, Benjamin Holcomb5, Hannah Loomis4, Hannah Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 6 DEC 1829 Exenia, Greene Co., Ohio, d. 5 JUL 1865 Demopolis, Sumpter Co., Alabama.
m. 14 SEP 1852 , Sangamon Co., Illinois, Harriet B. "Ella" Broadwell , b. 30 APR 1832 , Sangamon Co., Illinois, d. 23 SEP 1859 Pleasant Plains, Sangamon Co., Illinois.
4 children: Norman Broadwell, Helen A, John Walter, .

(6) Candace Holcomb (Eldad Holcomb5, Hannah Loomis4, Hannah Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 AUG 1771 Granby, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts, d. ABT 1831 Croton, Licking Co., Ohio.

(6) Philetus Cooley (Lois Holcomb5, Hannah Loomis4, Hannah Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 MAY 1773 Granby, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
m. Polly Hinman , b. , d. .
3 children: Jefferson, Eunice, Elizabeth B..
(7) Jefferson Cooley (Philetus Cooley6, Lois Holcomb5, Hannah Loomis4, Hannah Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 SEP 1800 Granby, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 20 DEC 1840 Granby, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesJEFFERSON graduated from Yale University and taught school at Granby. He studied law under Jared Griswold of Hartford. In 1836 he became Preceptor of the Poughkeepsie Academy. He was made Principal of the Academy at Sharon, Connecticut, in 1837.

(3) David Dewey (Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 11 JAN 1676 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 30 NOV 1712 Westfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
NotesDAVID was a weaver. He was a member of the Westfield church for 12 years, and was made a deacon in 1712. Several of his spiritual writing were published in a commemerative pamphlet after his death.

NotesGeorge enlisted 2 Septebmer 1861, was a Corporal in Company E, 7th Wisconsin Infantry Regiment and was killed 10 May 1864 at the Battle of Laurel Hill during the Civil War. He is buried in Arlington National Cemetery.

m. 29 JAN 1756 Hebron, Tolland Co., Connecticut, Deborah Buell , b. 13 SEP 1735 Marlborough, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 20 JAN 1813 .
11 children: Deborah, Joseph, Mary, Lydia, Anna, Jerusha, Elias, Chester, Sully, Hannah, Marcia.
(6) Deborah Dewey (Joseph Dewey5, Charles Dewey4, David Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 11 AUG 1756 Hebron, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. APR 1837 Ashtabula, Ashtabula Co., Ohio.
NotesDEBORAH and her husband moved from Lebanon, Connecticut, to Columbia Co., New York, and then Delhi, Delaware Co., New York, in 1776, where eight of their nine children were born and raised. Her husband died from being thrown by a horse, when a spring-lance he carried in his pocket pierced his side. In 1802, Deborah took her four youngest children by ox drawn wagon to Ohio where her son, Abraham, and his wife had settled in 1801. They settled in a log cabin at what is now Austinburg, Ohio, with Indian neighbors. Her biography was printed in the 1915 Wolcott Society annual report.
m. DEC 1774 Hebron, Tolland Co., Connecticut, George Webster , b. Of Lebanon, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 1800 , Delaware Co., New York.
9 children: Cynthia, Abraham, Persis, Wealthy, Belinda, George, Polly, Philo, Lewis.

(9) Howard Roy Dewey (George Nelson Dewey8, Isaac Anson Dewey7, Isaac Dewey6, Isaac Dewey5, Isaac Dewey4, David Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 21 JUL 1879 , d. .
(9) Dwight Mortimer Estes Dewey (George Nelson Dewey8, Isaac Anson Dewey7, Isaac Dewey6, Isaac Dewey5, Isaac Dewey4, David Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 28 MAR 1876 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 28 NOV 1943 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesDWIGHT was a Captain in the Connecticut Company Governor's Foot Guard. Prior to his death,he was in charge of Hartford Dog Show. He was made a member of The Oder of the Founders and Patriots of America, Society No.306, General No. 1399 on May 27,1925. He was made a member of the Connecticut Society of the Sons of the American Revolution on February 23,1925. National No. 41161, State No. 2676. Dwight is buried in Rose Hill Cemetary in Rocky Hill,CT in Section 8.

(6) Seth Keep (Esther Hoar5, Deborah Colton4, Ephraim Colton3, Mary Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 MAY 1771 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 8 JUN 1857 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
NotesSeth removed to Vermont, after marriage, and in 1801 moved to Homer, New York. He was a farmer, as were all his sons. He was for many years a member of the Congregational church.

NotesGLENN graduated from the School of Mines at the Univeristy of Utah as a Mining Metallurgical and Chemical Engineer. In 1925 he was with Cerro de Pasco Copper Corporation and was building a plant at the 14,000 level in the Andes Mountains of Peru.

(8) Edward Purington Keep (Ethan Keep7, Simeon Keep6, Esther Hoar5, Deborah Colton4, Ephraim Colton3, Mary Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 JUN 1833 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 1900 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
NotesEDWARD and his sister, Mary, were raised by his aunt and uncle, Limira Keep Chapin and Marcus Chapin. He and Mary were the heirs of Marcus, whose children predeceased him. He was given Marcus' 100 acre dairy farm. Edward donated $40,000 to obtain the Tiffany glass windows for the First Congregational Church in Monson, Massachusetts, where he was a deacon.

NotesETHAN was a farmer at Monson, Massachusetts.
m. Lydia Hubbard , b. , d. .
(7) Lamira Goodell Keep (Simeon Keep6, Esther Hoar5, Deborah Colton4, Ephraim Colton3, Mary Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 5 JAN 1805 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 15 NOV 1873 .
NotesLAMIRA and her husband purchased a home in 1854. It became a dairy farm, and had several small rock quarries. In 1856, Marcus conveyed the home to his nephew, Edward Keep, as his own children had all predeceased him. Marcus' estate was divided between his nephew and neice, Edward and Mary Keep, who he had raised. The home is now the Keep Homestead Museum.

NotesCHARLES was mustered in as Corporal of Company E, 36th Massachusetts Regiment, 17 July 1862 and died of dysentery at Crab Orchard, Kentucky during the Civil War.

m. 12 SEP 1863 Margaret Elizabeth Range , b. , d. .
(8) David Wood King (Persis Wood7, Abigail Keep6, Esther Hoar5, Deborah Colton4, Ephraim Colton3, Mary Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 31 AUG 1830 West Winfield, Herkimer Co., New York, d. 26 JAN 1921 Algona, Kossuth Co., Iowa.
NotesDAVID picked corn for Dr. Brooks in Des Moines, Iowa, in the fall of 1854. He then drove a yoke of oxen from Des Moines to Algona, Iowa, for Ambrose Call. He was one of the first settlers in Kossuth Co., Iowa, a farmer and railroad worker. He was on the members of the first Board of Supervisors for Kossuth Co.
m. 6 DEC 1860 West Winfield, Herkimer Co., New York, Anne Lydia "Lyddie" Hall , b. 10 AUG 1834 New York Mills, Oneida Co., New York, d. 16 SEP 1926 Algona, Kossuth Co., Iowa.
8 children: William Hall, Belle Persis, Ulysses Grant, David Phineas, Lydia May, Arthur Alonzo, Walter Samuel, Fred Menzo.

NotesSTEPHEN served in Capt. Abel King's Co., Col. Sear's Regt. at Saratoga, from 20 August 1781 to 20 November 1781. He was placed on the pension roll 13 April 1830.

NotesWilliam was a contractor and builder. At the time of his death he had a contract for the construction of the railroad from Dedham to Boston.

m. Anna , b. , d. .
(3) Sarah Drake (Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 MAY 1686 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 20 JAN 1747 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. 3 DEC 1702 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Roger Wolcott , b. 4 JAN 1679 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 17 MAY 1767 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
15 children: Roger, Elizabeth, Alexander, Samuel, Alexander, Sarah, Sarah, Hepzibah, Josiah, Erastus, Epaphras, Erastus, Ursula, Oliver, Mariann.
(4) Roger Wolcott (Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 SEP 1704 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 10 OCT 1759 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesROGER lived in South Windsor, his property adjoining that of his uncle, Henry. He was a Representative for Windsor at the General Assembly, a Major in the Connecticut militia, a member of the Council, and Judge of the Hartford County Court and the Superior Court of Connecticut. Roger was one of those appointed to revise the laws of the Connecticut Colony, and was one of three commissioners appointed by the Colony of Connecticut to meet at Albany in 1745 with representatives of other colonies, to discuss a plan for union. He was one of the subscribers to the Susquehanna Land Company in 1753.
m. 10 OCT 1728 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Mary "Mara" Newberry , b. 3 FEB 1710 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 5 JUN 1758 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
11 children: Roger, Marah, Roger, Sarah, Roger, Epaphras, Mary, Emeline, Parmenio, Amelia, Martha.
(5) Roger Wolcott (Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 19 SEP 1729 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 15 NOV 1729 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(5) Marah Wolcott (Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 OCT 1730 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 14 AUG 1737 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(5) Roger Wolcott (Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 JUN 1733 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1 NOV 1736 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(5) Sarah Wolcott (Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 7 JUN 1735 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 28 APR 1812 .
m. 26 APR 1758 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Elisha Steele , b. 7 OCT 1728 Tolland Township, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 17 AUG 1773 Tolland Township, Tolland Co., Connecticut.
6 children: Sarah, Mary, Mary Ann, Elisha, Roger, Mehitable.
(6) Sarah Steele (Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 19 APR 1759 Tolland Township, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 15 JUL 1790 .
m. 9 DEC 1779 Justus Reed , b. 17 OCT 1760 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. OCT 1864 .
1 children: Sarah.
(7) Sarah Reed (Sarah Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 26 OCT 1785 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 23 MAR 1846 .
m. Phineas Blodgett , b. 2 NOV 1783 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 20 APR 1842 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
5 children: Sarah Maria "Mary", Elizabeth May, Abigail Reed, Phineas Lafayette, Lavellette Clayton,
(8) Sarah Maria "Mary" Blodgett (Sarah Reed7, Sarah Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 29 MAY 1810 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 23 JUN 1897 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. 6 JAN 1831 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, John Terry Thompson , b. 10 APR 1805 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 7 FEB 1894 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
2 children: Lucius Edward, Charles Edward.
(9) Lucius Edward Thompson (Sarah Maria "Mary" Blodgett8, Sarah Reed7, Sarah Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 DEC 1831 Rockville, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. .
(9) Charles Edward Thompson (Sarah Maria "Mary" Blodgett8, Sarah Reed7, Sarah Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 26 FEB 1847 Rockville, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 25 SEP 1924 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesCHARLES moved to Hartford in 1863. He enlisted in the Hartford National Guard in 1865. In 1876 he was employed in the financial department of the Connecticut Life Insurance Co., and worked there until 1921. Charles was appointed 1st Lt. of Co. K, of the National Guard in 1879, and became Capt. of that unit in 1883. He was appointed commanding officer of the First Regiment of the Connecticut National Guard in 1885 and served in that office until 1890. He served as President of the Hartford YMCA and the Hartford Missionary Society, and was a deacon in the Congregational Church. He was also Governor of the Mayflower Society for Connecticut. He was a member of the Wolcott Society 1909-16, and Chairman of the Executive Committee in 1916.

(8) Maria Stuart (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 DEC 1804 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 25 DEC 1885 .
m. 23 JUN 1833 Charles A. Haviland , b. ABT 1809 ,, New York, d. .
2 children: Charles Elisha, Amelia.
(9) Charles Elisha Haviland (Maria Stuart8, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 4 SEP 1835 ,, New York, d. 13 MAR 1887 Hamburg, Erie Co., New York.
NotesCHARLES Was at Hamburg, New York, in 1860 with wife Mary Ann and daughter Anna.

He served in the Civil War.

Its interesting that she has a grave stone in both Dexter, Michigan and Hamburg, New York. What's even stranger is that the stone in NY is a double stone with both "Annie" and C E on it. This is strange because Charles Elisha Haviland remarried and had children with his second wife yet he or someone who outlived him chose to put his first wife on the stone with him. I have talked with the sexton of the cemetery in Hamburg.
I told him Annie also has a grave marked in Michigan. He said this cemetery didn't open until 1878 so its entirely possible her name is just on the stone, that there is no body there. He said on the backside of the lot where this stone rests is the Frinks, W. Henry and Anna liza !! Charles Elisha's second wife was the daughter of W. Henry and Anna Liza Frink.
(9) Amelia Haviland (Maria Stuart8, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1844 ,, New York, d. .

(9) Russell Marvin Cadwell (Adaline Stuart8, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1832 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. MAY 1899 .
NotesRUSSELL is found in the Iosco Township, Livingston Co., Michigan 1860: Russell M. Cadwell, 28, farmer born in New York; Harriet E., 24, NY; Ard R., 2, MI; and Geroge D. 1/12. MI. They are living next to his mother and father-in-law.
He is found in the Bath Township, Clinton Co., Michigan 1870 census: Cadwell, Russell M. 38, Railroad Agent born in New York; Harriet, 33, NY; Ard, 12, MI; George, 10, MI; and William, 5, MI. They are found on the same census page has her parents and sister, Martha.
They are found in the Meridan Township, Ingham Co., Michigan 1880 census: Cadwell, Russell M., 47, farmer; Harriet E., 44; George A., 20; and William J., 15.

He is found in the Leslie, Ingham Co., Michigan 1880 census: Haviland, Alanson, 39, and Etta, 14. In some record is name is given as Louis.

(9) Parson H. Stuart (Elisha S. Stuart8, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1848 , d. 1916 .
(8) Martha Stuart (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 JUN 1814 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 17 FEB 1815 , Jefferson Co., New York.
(8) Roger Wolcott Stuart (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 MAR 1818 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 5 JAN 1847 .
m. 15 JAN 1845 Lorinda Prenille , b. , d. .
(8) William Henry Stuart (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 MAY 1820 Chaumont, Jefferson Co., New York, d. 30 JUN 1893 Gowanda, Cattarauqua Co., New York.
NotesWILLIAM came to Michigan in 1830, but returned to Rochester, New York in 1831 where he worked in a printing office. He went to Michigan again in 1834, and again returned to New York where he worked with his brother, Samuel, operating a woolen manufacturing company in Wheatland, Monroe County, New York. He established a woolen factory in 1863 at Lodi, New York, later called Gowanda. He was Librarian of the New York State Senate in 1865, and was elected to the New York State Assembly in 1869. He was later postmaster at Gowanda. William was a Republican and a Mason, and wrote poetry.
m. 27 JAN 1842 Lyme, Jefferson Co., New York, Barbara Allen , b. 2 OCT 1822 , d. 14 SEP 1861 .
5 children: Eben A. "Ahaz", Alice E., Cora V., Glenn D., Maude.
(9) Eben A. "Ahaz" Stuart (William Henry Stuart8, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 OCT 1842 , Cattaraugus Co., New York, d. 1 OCT 1858 , Cattaraugus Co., New York.
(9) Alice E. Stuart (William Henry Stuart8, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1846 , Cattaraugus Co., New York, d. .
(9) Cora V. Stuart (William Henry Stuart8, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1848 , Cattaraugus Co., New York, d. .
(9) Glenn D. Stuart (William Henry Stuart8, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1859 , Cattaraugus Co., New York, d. .
(9) Maude Stuart (William Henry Stuart8, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1861 , Cattaraugus Co., New York, d. 2 FEB 1881 , Cattaraugus Co., New York.
(8) William Henry Stuart (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 MAY 1820 Chaumont, Jefferson Co., New York, d. 30 JUN 1893 Gowanda, Cattarauqua Co., New York.
NotesWILLIAM came to Michigan in 1830, but returned to Rochester, New York in 1831 where he worked in a printing office. He went to Michigan again in 1834, and again returned to New York where he worked with his brother, Samuel, operating a woolen manufacturing company in Wheatland, Monroe County, New York. He established a woolen factory in 1863 at Lodi, New York, later called Gowanda. He was Librarian of the New York State Senate in 1865, and was elected to the New York State Assembly in 1869. He was later postmaster at Gowanda. William was a Republican and a Mason, and wrote poetry.

NotesWOLCOTT was a farmer at Alexandria, New York, with 9 cows and 50 acres off land.
(6) Roger Steele (Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 19 JUN 1768 Tolland Township, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. .

m. AFT 1773 Elijah Chapman , b. , d. .
(5) Roger Wolcott (Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 NOV 1737 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 8 JAN 1798 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesROGER marched to Boston at the Lexington alarm as an Ensign and standard bearer in Capt. Amasa Loomis' Co.. He was a member of the Executive Committee of the Susquahanna Company, a land developmeny company formed to market land in the Wyoming Valley of Pennsylvania. In 1790 his family consisted of 2 males over 16, 1 male under 16, 3 females, and 1 free Negro at East Windsor, Connecticut.
m. ABT 1755 Dorcas Burnham , b. 15 MAY 1737 East Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 11 NOV 1823 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
13 children: Martha, Roger, Abner, Jemima, Cornelius, Hannah, Abigail, Seth, Amelia, Emelia, Oliver, , Rhoda.

(6) Roger Wolcott (Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 MAY 1760 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 19 DEC 1799 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesROGER was at East Windsor in 1790 with 2 males over 16, 1 male under 16, 2 females, and 1 free Negro. His widow and her three daughters moved from Bridgewater, Connecticut, to Evans Mills, New York, after his death. The widow and her unmarried daughter, Polly, lived with her daughter, Sarah Wolcott Rogers, at LeRoy, New York.
m. ABT 1782 Mary Ann Steele , b. 28 APR 1763 Tolland Township, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 26 OCT 1853 Evans Mills, Jefferson Co., New York.
9 children: , Mary Ann "Mariann", Mehitable, Mehitable, Oliver, Mary, Martha Burnham, Sarah Steele "Sally", Mary "Polly".

(9) Cornelia Rogers (Esther Stuart8, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 DEC 1845 , d. 28 JAN 1905 Philadelphia, Jefferson Co., New York.
(8) Maria Stuart (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 DEC 1804 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 25 DEC 1885 .
m. 23 JUN 1833 Charles A. Haviland , b. ABT 1809 ,, New York, d. .
2 children: Charles Elisha, Amelia.
(9) Charles Elisha Haviland (Maria Stuart8, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 4 SEP 1835 ,, New York, d. 13 MAR 1887 Hamburg, Erie Co., New York.
NotesCHARLES Was at Hamburg, New York, in 1860 with wife Mary Ann and daughter Anna.

He served in the Civil War.

Its interesting that she has a grave stone in both Dexter, Michigan and Hamburg, New York. What's even stranger is that the stone in NY is a double stone with both "Annie" and C E on it. This is strange because Charles Elisha Haviland remarried and had children with his second wife yet he or someone who outlived him chose to put his first wife on the stone with him. I have talked with the sexton of the cemetery in Hamburg.
I told him Annie also has a grave marked in Michigan. He said this cemetery didn't open until 1878 so its entirely possible her name is just on the stone, that there is no body there. He said on the backside of the lot where this stone rests is the Frinks, W. Henry and Anna liza !! Charles Elisha's second wife was the daughter of W. Henry and Anna Liza Frink.
(9) Amelia Haviland (Maria Stuart8, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1844 ,, New York, d. .
(8) Amelia Stuart (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 FEB 1807 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 26 DEC 1887 Dexter, Washtenaw Co., Michigan.

10 children: Marvin Stuart, Jason Russell, Charles, William H., Emeline A., Mary Ann, George W., Warren Wolcott, Ella J., Olive.

m. 21 JUL 1829 Russell Cadwell , b. ABT 1802 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .

(9) Russell Marvin Cadwell (Adaline Stuart8, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1832 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. MAY 1899 .
NotesRUSSELL is found in the Iosco Township, Livingston Co., Michigan 1860: Russell M. Cadwell, 28, farmer born in New York; Harriet E., 24, NY; Ard R., 2, MI; and Geroge D. 1/12. MI. They are living next to his mother and father-in-law.
He is found in the Bath Township, Clinton Co., Michigan 1870 census: Cadwell, Russell M. 38, Railroad Agent born in New York; Harriet, 33, NY; Ard, 12, MI; George, 10, MI; and William, 5, MI. They are found on the same census page has her parents and sister, Martha.
They are found in the Meridan Township, Ingham Co., Michigan 1880 census: Cadwell, Russell M., 47, farmer; Harriet E., 44; George A., 20; and William J., 15.
(8) Adaline Stuart (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 JUL 1809 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 26 MAR 1881 Iosco, Livingston Co., Michigan.
NotesADELINE Haviland purchased land at Washtenaw Co., Michigan, in 1837.
m. 1835 Lewis Jay Haviland , b. 1807 ,, New York, d. 4 JAN 1893 Iosco, Livingston Co., Michigan.

(9) Lewis Alanson "Alonzo" Haviland (Adaline Stuart8, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 31 MAR 1837 ,, Michigan, d. 21 DEC 1913 , Livingston Co., Michigan.
NotesLEWIS enlisted with his brother, Delos, 20 June 1861 in the Livingston County, Michigan, "Old Fourth Infantry", and was dischargedEWor disability 15 Jan. 1863. He is found in the Leslie, Ingham Co., Michigan 1880 census: Haviland, Alanson, 39, and Etta, 14. In some record is name is given as Louis.

(9) Parson H. Stuart (Elisha S. Stuart8, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1848 , d. 1916 .
(8) Martha Stuart (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 JUN 1814 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 17 FEB 1815 , Jefferson Co., New York.
(8) Roger Wolcott Stuart (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 MAR 1818 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 5 JAN 1847 .
m. 15 JAN 1845 Lorinda Prenille , b. , d. .
(8) William Henry Stuart (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 MAY 1820 Chaumont, Jefferson Co., New York, d. 30 JUN 1893 Gowanda, Cattarauqua Co., New York.
NotesWILLIAM came to Michigan in 1830, but returned to Rochester, New York in 1831 where he worked in a printing office. He went to Michigan again in 1834, and again returned to New York where he worked with his brother, Samuel, operating a woolen manufacturing company in Wheatland, Monroe County, New York. He established a woolen factory in 1863 at Lodi, New York, later called Gowanda. He was Librarian of the New York State Senate in 1865, and was elected to the New York State Assembly in 1869. He was later postmaster at Gowanda. William was a Republican and a Mason, and wrote poetry.
m. 27 JAN 1842 Lyme, Jefferson Co., New York, Barbara Allen , b. 2 OCT 1822 , d. 14 SEP 1861 .
5 children: Eben A. "Ahaz", Alice E., Cora V., Glenn D., Maude.
(9) Eben A. "Ahaz" Stuart (William Henry Stuart8, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 OCT 1842 , Cattaraugus Co., New York, d. 1 OCT 1858 , Cattaraugus Co., New York.
(9) Alice E. Stuart (William Henry Stuart8, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1846 , Cattaraugus Co., New York, d. .
(9) Cora V. Stuart (William Henry Stuart8, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1848 , Cattaraugus Co., New York, d. .
(9) Glenn D. Stuart (William Henry Stuart8, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1859 , Cattaraugus Co., New York, d. .
(9) Maude Stuart (William Henry Stuart8, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1861 , Cattaraugus Co., New York, d. 2 FEB 1881 , Cattaraugus Co., New York.
(8) William Henry Stuart (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 MAY 1820 Chaumont, Jefferson Co., New York, d. 30 JUN 1893 Gowanda, Cattarauqua Co., New York.
NotesWILLIAM came to Michigan in 1830, but returned to Rochester, New York in 1831 where he worked in a printing office. He went to Michigan again in 1834, and again returned to New York where he worked with his brother, Samuel, operating a woolen manufacturing company in Wheatland, Monroe County, New York. He established a woolen factory in 1863 at Lodi, New York, later called Gowanda. He was Librarian of the New York State Senate in 1865, and was elected to the New York State Assembly in 1869. He was later postmaster at Gowanda. William was a Republican and a Mason, and wrote poetry.

NotesANTOINETTE lived in New York City in 1920 when she joined the Wolcott Society.
(9) Isabel W. Harris (Francis E. "Fanny" Seamans8, Amelia Steele7, Jemima Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1867 Worcester, Worcester Co., Massachusetts, d. .
(9) Francis J. "Frank" Harris (Francis E. "Fanny" Seamans8, Amelia Steele7, Jemima Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1871 Brooklyn, Kings Co., New York, d. JAN 1914 .
(8) Sophia S. Seamans (Amelia Steele7, Jemima Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 5 SEP 1844 Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 17 JAN 1845 Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
(6) Cornelius Wolcott (Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 JUL 1765 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 29 APR 1812 at Sea.
NotesCORNELIUS drowned in Podunk Brook, while crossing on a plank when the river was flooding. His funeral was recorded in the diary of Rev. Thomas Robbins. Podunk Brook is between Windsor and Hartford, Connecticut.
m. Margaret Williams , b. 1776 , d. 11 JAN 1819 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
7 children: William Williams, Elizabeth, Oliver, Abner, Roger, Cornelius, Martha Treat.
(7) William Williams Wolcott (Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 6 OCT 1791 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 22 JUL 1811 .
(7) Elizabeth Wolcott (Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 26 JUN 1793 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1883 Mendota, LaSalle Co., Illinois.
m. 1 JUN 1812 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Henry Gilman , b. 2 FEB 1791 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1825 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
4 children: Charles Henry, William Wolcott, Maria, Martha.
(8) Charles Henry Gilman (Elizabeth Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 MAR 1817 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 15 APR 1880 Ottawa, LaSalle Co., Illinois.
NotesCHARLES was a La Salle County judge.
m. 16 NOV 1843 Roxanna Mann , b. 12 JUL 1813 Mansfield, Tioga Co., Pennsylvania, d. 19 NOV 1878 Ottawa, LaSalle Co., Illinois.
3 children: William Henry, Elizabeth, Georgia.
(9) William Henry Gilman (Charles Henry Gilman8, Elizabeth Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 MAY 1849 Homer, Champaign Co., Illinois, d. .
(9) Elizabeth Gilman (Charles Henry Gilman8, Elizabeth Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 3 SEP 1844 Homer, Champaign Co., Illinois, d. .
(9) Georgia Gilman (Charles Henry Gilman8, Elizabeth Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 JUN 1846 Homer, Champaign Co., Illinois, d. 3 SEP 1931 Ottawa, LaSalle Co., Illinois.
NotesGEORGIA joined the Wolcott Society in 1917 as member 28.
(8) William Wolcott Gilman (Elizabeth Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
m. Susan Charles , b. , d. .
(8) Maria Gilman (Elizabeth Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
m. William Valentine , b. , d. .

m. Andrew Lowrill , b. , d. .
(7) Oliver Wolcott (Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 26 JUL 1796 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 26 NOV 1872 .
NotesOLIVER Wolcott, 50, born Connecticut, was living at Barre, New York, in 1830. He was there in 1840 with 1 male 40-50, 1 female 40-50, and 3 young females under 15. He was a farmer at Barre in 1850, with wife Mary 47, Laura Wolcott 17, Martha Wolcott 14, and William Borrows 10. In 1850 William Borrows was no longer with him. In 1860 he was at Barre with Mary and Laura S. Woolcott. In 1865 he was living with his daughter, Laura, at Barre. In 1875, part of Barre became the town of Albion.
m. 27 APR 1826 Enfield, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Mary Mumford , b. 7 SEP 1799 ,, Connecticut, d. 31 MAY 1864 .
4 children: Mary Amelia, James, Laura Sedana, Martha Elizabeth.
(8) Mary Amelia Wolcott (Oliver Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 FEB 1827 Barre, Orleans Co., New York, d. 26 JUL 1848 Barre, Orleans Co., New York.
(8) James Wolcott (Oliver Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1831 Barre, Orleans Co., New York, d. .
(8) Laura Sedana Wolcott (Oliver Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 MAR 1833 Barre, Orleans Co., New York, d. .
m. 19 NOV 1864 Barre, Orleans Co., New York, Theodore Birch , b. 1831 , Wayne Co., New York, d. .
(8) Martha Elizabeth Wolcott (Oliver Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 SEP 1836 Barre, Orleans Co., New York, d. 3 FEB 1911 Albion, Orleans Co., New York.
m. 26 JAN 1860 ,, New York, Carlton A. Paine , b. 2 APR 1834 ,, New York, d. 17 MAR 1901 Barre, Orleans Co., New York.
2 children: Oliver A., Carlton Jerome.
(9) Oliver A. Paine (Martha Elizabeth Wolcott8, Oliver Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. APR 1861 Barre, Orleans Co., New York, d. 14 APR 1937 Clifton Springs, Ontario Co., New York.
(9) Carlton Jerome Paine (Martha Elizabeth Wolcott8, Oliver Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 28 JUL 1872 Barre, Orleans Co., New York, d. 13 JUL 1873 Barre, Orleans Co., New York.
(7) Abner Wolcott (Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 24 AUG 1798 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 8 OCT 1854 Rock Island, Rock Island Co., Illinois.
NotesABNER was a millwright. He moved to Iowa in 1837. He was one of the first three County Commissionesr for Johnson County, Iowa, elected in 1838. He served on the first Grand Jury and made out the first tax list for the county. In 1841 Abner Woolcott of Johnson Co., Iowa, purchased 80 acres of government land in Iowa. He left Iowa in 1843 for Rock Island, Illinois. He purchased a farm on Lowell Island near Milan, Illinois. In 1850 he was a millwright at Rock Island Co., Illinois, with wife Elizabeth, 25 or 29 born Ohio, and Cornelius 4, and John 5 mo. both born Illinois.
m. 8 APR 1844 , Rock Island Co., Illinois, Elizabeth Ann Wisecarver , b. 1825 ,, Ohio, d. .
4 children: Cornelius Roger, John Abner, Katheryn, William Henry.
(8) Cornelius Roger Wolcott (Abner Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 23 OCT 1845 Rock Island, Rock Island Co., Illinois, d. 24 OCT 1921 .
NotesCORNELIUS R. Wolcott of Black Hawk, Illinios, enlisted 4 Oct. 1864 as a Pvt. in Co. I, 126th Illinois Inf. Regt., and was mustered out when the unit was disbanded on 12 July 1865.

Nora Wolcott, dates and relationship unknown, is buried in the same cemetery.
m. 23 OCT 1867 , Rock Island Co., Illinois, Sarah Zeonora Zabrisky , b. 13 JUN 1850 , d. 30 JAN 1926 .
(8) John Abner Wolcott (Abner Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1850 Rock Island, Rock Island Co., Illinois, d. .
(8) Katheryn Wolcott (Abner Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. Rock Island, Rock Island Co., Illinois, d. .
(8) William Henry Wolcott (Abner Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 29 MAY 1852 Rock Island, Rock Island Co., Illinois, d. 14 AUG 1935 .
NotesWILLIAM was a railroad brakeman at Muscatine, Iowa, in 1880. He was a minister at Allison, Iowa, 1906-8. His gravestone reads "Engineer Clergyman".
m. 4 NOV 1874 Alice Lucinda Wilson , b. 1857 Pen Hook,, Indiana, d. 17 JAN 1932 Sergent Bluff, Woodbury Co., Iowa.
4 children: Edgar Cornelius "Wally", William Abner, Sylvester Paul, Raymond Franklin.
(9) Edgar Cornelius "Wally" Wolcott (William Henry Wolcott8, Abner Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 22 APR 1881 Muscatine, Muscatine Co., Iowa, d. 6 NOV 1975 St. Louis, St. Louis Co., Missouri.
NotesEDGAR was pastor of the Mayflower Congregational Church at Sioux City, Iowa. He joined the Wolcott Society in 1916, residing at Sioux City, Iowa. At that time he was doing social work with boys. He was member #15. In 1921 he founded the High Twelve International of the Masonic Order which now has over 350 clubs. He served as president, secretary and treasurer, and travelled more than 400,000 miles to form 164 clubs. The clubs meet weekly at noon for lunch. He moved to Kansas City in 1922, and later to St. Louis, Missouri. He lived at Evanston, Illinois, in 1929. He rejoined the Wolcott Society in 1955 as member #568, residing at St. Louis, Missouri.

1918 Draft Registration:
Edgar Cornelius Wolcott 37, b. 22 Apr 1881 Sioux City, Woodbury Co., Iowa, YMCA Secretary, Sioux City, wife Myrtle B. Wolcott, tall, medium build, blue eyes, brown hair

1920 Woodbury Co., IL:
Edgar C Wolcott M 38y
Spouse Myrtle B Wolcott F 35y
Child Margaret Wolcott F 16y
Child Catherine Wolcott F 12y
(9) William Abner Wolcott (William Henry Wolcott8, Abner Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1884 Muscatine, Muscatine Co., Iowa, d. .
(9) Sylvester Paul Wolcott (William Henry Wolcott8, Abner Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 JUL 1888 Muscatine, Muscatine Co., Iowa, d. 24 AUG 1958 .
NotesSYLVESTER was at Sioux City, Iowa, in 1930 with Elsie B., Gloria E., Babette A. and Shirley P. Wolcott.

Military gravestone: Sylvester Paul Wolcott, enlisted 19 May 1915, discharged 31 Jan. 1919, SFC, Iowa, Ambulance Co. 136, b. 2 July 1887, died 7 Aug 1958; Memorial Park Sioux City IA
(9) Raymond Franklin Wolcott (William Henry Wolcott8, Abner Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 APR 1892 ,, Iowa, d. 6 AUG 1949 , Pima Co., Arizona.
NotesRAYMOND was at Minneapolis, Minnesota, in 1930, with Blanche, Helen E., and R. Oliver Wolcott. He moved to Tucson about 1940, where he was a barber.
(7) Roger Wolcott (Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 31 MAY 1800 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
NotesROGER is said to have "Gone South".
(7) Cornelius Wolcott (Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 SEP 1807 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 23 JAN 1848 Springfield, Hampshire, after 1812 Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
NotesCORNELIUS Woolcott of Enfield married Sophia Hall of Longmeadow at Longmeadow. His gravestone reads: Cornelius Wolcott died Jan. 13 1848 ae. 41.
m. 25 JAN 1827 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, Sophia Sweatland Hall , b. 13 JAN 1813 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 18 NOV 1858 Springfield, Hampshire, after 1812 Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
2 children: Oliver, Gordon Hall.
(8) Oliver Wolcott (Cornelius Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 MAY 1827 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 8 NOV 1888 Palmer, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
NotesOLIVER was orphaned at a young age and was raised by Quakers at Enfield, Connecticut. He came to East Longmeadow, Massachusetts, in 1852, where he was a stone mason. He became foreman of a sandstone quarry at East Long Meadow. He and wife, Amelia, were at Longmeadow in 1860, with Amelia's daughter Rosa C. Wolcott. He was one of the founders of the Methodist Church there, and a trustee until his death. He was a farmer at Longmeadow in 1880. He did not have a middle name, according to his great-grandson, John Martin. It was previously thought to be Louis.
m. 18 JAN 1854 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, Emily Jane "Emma" Salisbury , b. 1 JUN 1834 East Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 11 AUG 1858 East Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
(8) Oliver Wolcott (Cornelius Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 MAY 1827 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 8 NOV 1888 Palmer, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
NotesOLIVER was orphaned at a young age and was raised by Quakers at Enfield, Connecticut. He came to East Longmeadow, Massachusetts, in 1852, where he was a stone mason. He became foreman of a sandstone quarry at East Long Meadow. He and wife, Amelia, were at Longmeadow in 1860, with Amelia's daughter Rosa C. Wolcott. He was one of the founders of the Methodist Church there, and a trustee until his death. He was a farmer at Longmeadow in 1880. He did not have a middle name, according to his great-grandson, John Martin. It was previously thought to be Louis.
m. 11 MAY 1860 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, Lydia Amelia Crocker , b. 22 JUN 1829 South Wilbraham, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 2 APR 1895 East Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
1 children: Oliver Louis.
(9) Oliver Louis Wolcott (Oliver Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 21 NOV 1863 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 26 APR 1948 Ojai, Ventura Co., California.
NotesOLIVER graduated from Wilbraham Academy in 1886. He was a draftsman for the Norcross Stone Co. He was the Town Clerk and Treasurer of East Longmeadow from when it was seperated from Longmeadow until 1901. He also served in this capacity from 1914 to 1918. In 1930 he was at East Longmeadow with Quentin L., Geneva E., Shirley G., and Robert Q. Wolcott. He was East Longmeadow Assessor 1909-30, school board member 1894-1911, library trustee, agent of the Board of Health Scalier of Weights and Measures. He was a member of the Hampden Odd Fellows and the First Methodist Church. Some of the information about his descendants was provided by his descendant, Mary Downey Mossner.

(7) William Henry "Henry" Wolcott (Seth Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. JUN 1811 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 2 APR 1899 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesWILLIAM "Henry" Wolcott was a machinist at Hartford, Connecticut, in 1850 with Almyra, Ella, and Frances Wolcott. William was at East Hartford, Connecticut, in 1860, with Almira, Ella J., and Frances Wolcott.

1870 East Hartford CT:
Wm H Wolcott M 60y, blacksmith
Almira Wolcott 44y
Ella Wolcott 23y, book binder
Fanny Wolcott 20y, book binder

He was a farmer at East Hartford in 1880.
Wm. H. Wolcott M 70
Spouse Almira Wolcott 54
Child Ella Wolcott 34
m. 24 SEP 1845 Almira Bissell , b. 1826 ,, Connecticut, d. .
2 children: Ella J., Frances.
(8) Ella J. Wolcott (William Henry "Henry" Wolcott7, Seth Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 13 JUL 1846 East Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 6 DEC 1892 .
NotesELLA lived with her parents and worked in a book bindery at East Hartford in 1880.
m. Sheldon A. Kilborn , b. 10 JAN 1852 , d. 22 JUN 1889 .
(8) Frances Wolcott (William Henry "Henry" Wolcott7, Seth Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 9 APR 1850 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
NotesFRANCES was a member of the Wolcott Society 1914-17, living at Manchester, Connecticut. Miss Bertha Clark of Manchester, probably her daughter, joined in 1915.
m. 1 NOV 1871 Frederick Belknap "Fred" Clark , b. , d. .
4 children: Elsie Wolcott, Harry Botsford, Frederick Belknap, Bertha A..
(9) Elsie Wolcott Clark (Frances Wolcott8, William Henry "Henry" Wolcott7, Seth Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 26 FEB 1877 East Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
NotesELSIE was a member of the Wolcott Society in 1914, residing at Manchester, Connecticut, but is not carried on the roster after that year, although her mothe and sisters were members.

m. Marion L. Aten , b. , d. .
1 children: Marion Burbridge.
(8) Marion Burbridge Aten (Mary Cornelia Burbridge7, Rhoda Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1840 , d. .
NotesMrs. Maria Burbridge Aten of Chicago was said to be the granddaughter of Rhoda Wolcott, born in Windsor, Connecticut, who came west when a young girl. She and Miss Stella Wolcott Aten attended the reunion of the Wolcott Society in 1914. Mrs. Marion L. Aten and Miss Stella Aten were members of the Wolcott Society in 1914. Mrs. Maria L. Aten and Stella were members in 1915. The 1918 Wolcott Society annual report gave Asa Burbridge and Elmer McLaughlin as grandsons of William and Caroline Burbridge, and cousins of Stella Wolcott Aten.
m. Maria L. , b. ABT 1850 , d. SEP 1916 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois.

NotesELMER served in the Navy during World War I.
(5) Epaphras Wolcott (Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 21 MAY 1740 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1 JAN 1825 .
NotesEPAPHRAS was at East Windsor, Connecticut, in 1790, with family of 1 male over 16 and 5 females. He is said to have enlisted in Capt. Giles Wolcott's Company and died while on that unit's expedition to Canada. If, so, the death date we have for him must be wrong. He is also said to have married at Rochester NY, which also seems to be in error.
m. JUN 1762 Mabel Burnham , b. 1735 East Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 27 MAR 1814 .
4 children: Sarah, James, Mabel, Mary.
(6) Sarah Wolcott (Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 JAN 1764 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 3 NOV 1853 Hadley, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts.
m. 5 FEB 1795 Wilbraham, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, Ebenezer Pomeroy , b. 1759 Of Hadley, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts, d. 26 OCT 1840 .
1 children: Infant.
(7) Infant Pomeroy (Sarah Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 7 MAR 1796 Hadley, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts, d. 11 MAR 1796 Hadley, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts.
(6) James Wolcott (Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 19 APR 1766 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 29 APR 1849 Wheatland, Monroe Co., New York.
NotesJAMES lived at East Windsor, Connecticut, where the birth of his sons, Anson, James, and Epaphras was recorded. He was there in 1790 with a family of 1 male over 16, 2 males under 16, and 1 female. He was an officer in the militia during in the War of 1812. His sword was given to his grandson, James MacGregor Wolcott, and was passed on to James' grandaughter, Jessie Humphrey Hunt. He settled at East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, where he lived for many years. He was living at Bloomfield in 1830. He and his wife later moved to Wheatland, New York, to live with their daughter, Miriam. A monument in the Wheatland Baptist Cemetery lists his children, Anson, Epaphras, James, Norman, and Miriam, and says: Anson married Lurinda Hawley Gillett at Mendon, NY. A successful and beloved teacher of Indians, English and deaf and dumb children. They settled in East Bloomfield NY. Prospered, were honored members of Bristol Baptist Church and large contributors. They had eight children." A small book about his descendants was printed by Chandler Wolcott in 1907.
m. JAN 1786 Wheatland, Monroe Co., New York, Miriam Munsell , b. 15 JAN 1767 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 24 JAN 1850 Wheatland, Monroe Co., New York.
7 children: Anson, Epaphras, James, Norman, Miriam, Sarah, Sarah.
(7) Anson Wolcott (James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 9 APR 1787 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 17 OCT 1864 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York.
NotesANSON came from the Springfield Armory, where he was employed, to Bloomfield, New York, to join his brother, Epaphras, in operating a distillery. Epaphras moved to Rochester, and Anson was joined by his brother, Norman. In 1826, Anson and Norman of Bloomfield registered a patent for "distilling all kinds of liquor". In 1827 they registered another patent for "extracting alcohol from common spirits by steam. Anson also patented an improved still for making alcohol from apples in 1836. In 1837 he deeded land at Ontario County, New York, to his brother, James Wolcott, Jr. He and his brother, Epaphras, also started a silk business, raising their own silkworms. He was at East Bloomfield in 1860 with Lurinda, Lurinda, Esther, and Emily Wolcott. In 1860 Anson Wolcott of East Bloomfield had a storekeeper's license. A monument to the children of James and Miriam Wolcott at Wheatland Baptiat Cemetery reads: "Anson married Lurinda Hawley Gilette at Mendon, NY. A successful and beloved teacher of Indians, English and deaf and dumb children. They settled in East Bloomfield NY. Prospered, were honored members of Bristol Baptist Church and large contributors. They had eight children."
m. 29 MAR 1821 Mendon, Monroe Co., New York, Lurinda Hawley Gillett , b. 1802 , d. 17 AUG 1869 Canandaigua, Ontario Co., New York.
7 children: Mary Ann, Susan Melissa, Anson Spencer "Spencer", Lurinda Gillette, Sarah Pomeroy, Asineath Esther "Esther", Frances Emily "Emily".
(8) Mary Ann Wolcott (Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 APR 1823 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 2 FEB 1914 Walker, Kent Co., Michigan.
NotesMARY Ann's death certificate says she was to be buried at Canadaugua, New York.
m. 18 SEP 1849 David K. Kendall , b. 24 JAN 1816 Millbury, Worcester Co., Massachusetts, d. 6 JUL 1862 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York.
3 children: David Wolcott, Olive Crane, Thomas Jefferson.
(9) David Wolcott Kendall (Mary Ann Wolcott8, Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 11 OCT 1851 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 16 FEB 1910 , Yucatan, Mexico.
NotesDAVID was in the furniture manufacturing business in Grand Rapids, Michigan. He was the chief designer of Reform and Mission style furniture for the Phoenix Furniture Company, and developed finishes that made oak furniture popular. The David Wolcott Kendall College of Art and Design in Grand Rapids is named for him and funded in his wife's will.
(9) Olive Crane Kendall (Mary Ann Wolcott8, Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 7 JUL 1853 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 11 NOV 1929 Bluffton, Allen Co., Ohio.
NotesOLIVE joined the Wolcott Society in 1917. She was active in the Fountain Street Baptist Church at Grand Rapids, the Society of Mayflower Descendants, and the D. A. R. Her estate was valued at $200,000.
(9) Thomas Jefferson Kendall (Mary Ann Wolcott8, Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 OCT 1855 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. .
(8) Susan Melissa Wolcott (Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 JAN 1825 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 27 DEC 1855 .
m. 17 OCT 1858 , Ontario Co., New York, Ezekiel J. Scudder , b. 17 FEB 1819 , d. 25 FEB 1878 .
1 children: Sarah Josephine.
(9) Sarah Josephine Scudder (Susan Melissa Wolcott8, Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 31 OCT 1860 , d. 31 AUG 1862 .
(8) Anson Spencer "Spencer" Wolcott (Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 22 MAR 1827 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 23 AUG 1911 Fayette, Howard Co., Missouri.
NotesANSON is also said to have been born in 1821. He was at East Bloomfield, New York, in 1860, with Sarah, Charles, and Eliza Wolcott. He was a fruit grower at Prairie, Missouri, in 1880.
m. 2 AUG 1855 Sarah P. Walker , b. 13 JUN 1829 Canandaigua, Ontario Co., New York, d. 9 MAY 1882 Prairie, Howard Co., Missouri.
3 children: Charles Spencer, Eliza Lurinda, George Franklin.
(9) Charles Spencer Wolcott (Anson Spencer "Spencer" Wolcott8, Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 13 MAY 1856 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 5 DEC 1886 Richmond, Ray Co., Missouri.
(9) Eliza Lurinda Wolcott (Anson Spencer "Spencer" Wolcott8, Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 4 AUG 1858 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 11 AUG 1884 .
(9) George Franklin Wolcott (Anson Spencer "Spencer" Wolcott8, Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 5 JAN 1868 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. NOV 1950 , Howard Co., Missouri.
NotesGEORGE lived at Fayette, Missouri, in 1913. In 1920 he was at Moniteau, Howard Co., Missouri.
(8) Anson Spencer "Spencer" Wolcott (Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 22 MAR 1827 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 23 AUG 1911 Fayette, Howard Co., Missouri.
NotesANSON is also said to have been born in 1821. He was at East Bloomfield, New York, in 1860, with Sarah, Charles, and Eliza Wolcott. He was a fruit grower at Prairie, Missouri, in 1880.
m. 6 AUG 1884 Kahoka.Clark Co., Missouri, Phebe A. Church , b. , d. .

NotesLURENDA is also said to be buried at Fayette, Missouri.

NotesCHARLES was a farmer at Hamlin, New York, in 1880, age 25, with wife Jennie 22, and Cora 1.
(8) Sarah Pomeroy Wolcott (Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 SEP 1832 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 3 JUN 1850 .
(8) Asineath Esther "Esther" Wolcott (Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 APR 1840 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. .
m. 15 AUG 1864 Delinar W. Scudder , b. 1840 ,, New York, d. .
1 children: Grace Lurenda.
(9) Grace Lurenda Scudder (Asineath Esther "Esther" Wolcott8, Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 OCT 1867 , d. .
(8) Frances Emily "Emily" Wolcott (Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 AUG 1842 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. .
m. 27 MAY 1866 Theodore Parker Whiting , b. , d. 20 APR 1878 Harrison Valley, Potter Co., Pennsylvania.
(7) Epaphras Wolcott (James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 7 APR 1789 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 25 AUG 1852 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
NotesEPAPHRAS was employed at the Springfield Armory. He left there and walked to New York state about 1808, and in 1811 purchased land in Wayne County, in what is now the town of Wolcott. He moved to Bloomfield, Ontario County, where he deeded land to Thomas and Benjamin Wheeler in 1814, Nathaniel, Lyman, and William Keyes in 1821, Richard Paul in 1821, nson Wolcott in 1821, Timothy Wilder in 1825, and Norman Wolcott in 1826. He appears on the Bloomfield 1820 census. His brother, Anson, joined him there in the operation of a distillery. In 1827 he moved to Rochester, where in 1830 he built the Wolcott Distillery and the Wolcott Tavern which he managed. His large frame house is still standing on the southwest corner of Mt. Hope Avenue and Clarissa St., looking much as it did in 1830 when the forest came to the very door of the house.

He is on the 1830 census at Brighton, Monroe Co., New York, which is near Rochester. Epaphras was a member of the First Baptist Church and was often called upon to speak at public meetings.
m. 25 MAY 1811 Naomi Paul , b. 19 AUG 1791 , d. 11 NOV 1853 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
7 children: Sarah Munsell, Anson Franklin, George Paul, Elvira Antoinette, Oliver Epaphras, Georgianna Melvina, Julia M..
(8) Sarah Munsell Wolcott (Epaphras Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 OCT 1812 Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 11 AUG 1903 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
NotesSARAH was a charter member of the Second Baptist Church at Rochester, New York, in 1834.
m. 13 FEB 1834 David R. Barton , b. 4 JUL 1805 , d. 25 APR 1875 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
8 children: Cornelia, Julia Munsell, Charles Casimir, Henry Epaphras, Augusta Anoinette, George Wolcott, Edward Munroe, Sarah Louisa.
(9) Cornelia Barton (Sarah Munsell Wolcott8, Epaphras Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 JUN 1836 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 21 JUN 1836 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
(9) Julia Munsell Barton (Sarah Munsell Wolcott8, Epaphras Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 APR 1838 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 11 MAY 1865 .

(9) Henry Epaphras Barton (Sarah Munsell Wolcott8, Epaphras Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 3 NOV 1842 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. Seattle, King Co., Washington.
(9) Augusta Anoinette Barton (Sarah Munsell Wolcott8, Epaphras Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 13 JAN 1845 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. .
(9) George Wolcott Barton (Sarah Munsell Wolcott8, Epaphras Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 3 DEC 1846 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 11 AUG 1847 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
(9) Edward Munroe Barton (Sarah Munsell Wolcott8, Epaphras Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 FEB 1849 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 7 APR 1885 .
(9) Sarah Louisa Barton (Sarah Munsell Wolcott8, Epaphras Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 28 SEP 1852 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 12 JAN 1886 .
(8) Anson Franklin Wolcott (Epaphras Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 JUN 1814 Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 6 APR 1892 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
NotesANSON lived most of his life at Rochester, New York.

1850 Rochester NY:
Anson F Wolcott M 36y
Elisa Ann Wolcott F 27y

In 1873 Anson and his brother, George, continued the distillery and tavern built by their father, as A. F & G. P. Wolcott, Distillers. In 1880 he was retired, living at Rochester, New York.
m. 13 OCT 1846 Ann Eliza Combs , b. 2 MAR 1822 ,, New York, d. 19 APR 1904 .
(8) George Paul Wolcott (Epaphras Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 24 NOV 1816 Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 10 AUG 1880 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
NotesGEORGE was a partner with his brother, Anson, in the distillery business at Rochester, New York. He served in the Civil War.

1850 Rochester NY:
George P Wolcott M 33y
Caroline E Wolcott F 28y
Henry E Wolcott M 2y
James E Wolcott M 1m
Maria Dutcher F 26y

He was at Rochester in 1879 with James E., Frank A,

1880 Rochester NY
James E. Wolcott M 30
Ida J. Wolcott F 27

George P. Wolcott M 63
Maggie Gutberlet F 24
m. 26 MAY 1846 Caroline Elizabeth Moore , b. 15 APR 1822 , d. 7 OCT 1871 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
4 children: Henry Epaphras, James Ephraim, Franklin Anson, Elizabeth Georgiana.
(9) Henry Epaphras Wolcott (George Paul Wolcott8, Epaphras Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 9 OCT 1847 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 22 JUL 1889 Rochester, Monroe Co., Michigan.
NotesHENRY was a Justice of the Peace at Rochester in 1872.

a banker in Lorado, Texas.
(9) James Ephraim Wolcott (George Paul Wolcott8, Epaphras Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 APR 1850 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 24 NOV 1906 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
NotesJAMES was a distiller and wholesale liquor dealer in Rochester, New York. He established the James E. Wolcott & Co. distillery there in 1827, and marketed whisky under the name of "Cornhill Rye". In 1892 he was a wholesaler at Rochester. He was at Rochester in 1900.

1892 Rochester NY:
James E. Wolcott 42, wholesaler
Ida J. Wolcott 40
Carrie R. Wolcott, 16
George P. Wolcott, 12
Charley Wolcott 11

1900 Rochester:
