(9) Helen Margaret McLaughlin (Frances Caroline Kirby8, Hannah McClure Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 21 OCT 1869 Gilroy, Santa Cruz Co., California, d. 1 MAR 1872 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
(8) Katherine Wolcott Kirby (Hannah McClure Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 8 JUL 1842 Mendon, Adams Co., Illinois, d. 20 MAR 1880 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
m. 9 SEP 1862 Charles Emery Ross , b. , d. 1908 .
4 children: Helen, Edward Kirby, Carlton Perry, Edith Wolcott.
(9) Helen Ross (Katherine Wolcott Kirby8, Hannah McClure Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 11 SEP 1863 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. .
(9) Edward Kirby Ross (Katherine Wolcott Kirby8, Hannah McClure Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 23 JAN 1865 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. .
(9) Carlton Perry Ross (Katherine Wolcott Kirby8, Hannah McClure Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 NOV 1868 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. .
(9) Edith Wolcott Ross (Katherine Wolcott Kirby8, Hannah McClure Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 JUL 1872 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. .
NotesEDITH was DAR member #10434.
(8) Helen McClure Kirby (Hannah McClure Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 JAN 1845 Mendon, Adams Co., Illinois, d. 29 JUL 1923 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
NotesHELEN was a member of the Wolcott Society in 1914 residing at Mt. Morris Park, New York., and vice-president for Eastern New York 1914-15.
m. 23 JUN 1870 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, Melatiah Everett Dwight , b. 15 OCT 1841 South Hadley, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts, d. 14 SEP 1907 Northampton, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts.
5 children: Ellsworth Everett, Richard Everett, William Kirby, Katharine Wolcott, Marion Edith.
(9) Ellsworth Everett Dwight (Helen McClure Kirby8, Hannah McClure Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 MAR 1871 Onarga, Iroquois Co., Illinois, d. 25 FEB 1955 .
NotesELLSWORTH was a physician living at Summit, New Jersey, in 1920, when he joined the Wolcott Society. He rejoined in 1951 as member #491, residing at Summit, New Jersey.
(9) Richard Everett Dwight (Helen McClure Kirby8, Hannah McClure Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 21 JUN 1875 Onarga, Iroquois Co., Illinois, d. .
(9) William Kirby Dwight (Helen McClure Kirby8, Hannah McClure Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 8 AUG 1879 , d. .
(9) Katharine Wolcott Dwight (Helen McClure Kirby8, Hannah McClure Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 13 AUG 1881 Fairfield, Jefferson Co., Iowa, d. 30 AUG 1967 New Haven, New Haven Co., Connecticut.
NotesKATHARINE graduated from Mt. Holyoke College. She joined the Wolcott Society in 1925 as member #95, residing at Paris, France. She was also a member of Magna Carta Dames.
(9) Marion Edith Dwight (Helen McClure Kirby8, Hannah McClure Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 27 FEB 1886 Fairfield, Jefferson Co., Iowa, d. .
(8) Henry Burgess Kirby (Hannah McClure Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 MAR 1848 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. 4 AUG 1849 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
(8) Elizabeth Pomeroy "Bessie" Kirby (Hannah McClure Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 APR 1850 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. .
NotesELIZABETH joined the Wolcott Society in 1916, residing at New York City.
(7) Samuel Wolcott (Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 JUL 1813 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 24 FEB 1886 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
Notes SAMUEL graduated from Yale College in 1833 and gave the Commencement Oration. He graduated from the Andover Theological Seminary in 1837, and was ordained in 1839. In 1837 his name is at the head of a number of Andover students who issued an anti-slavery manifesto. Samuel was a missionary to Syria from 1840 to 1843. He is said to have been one of two Americans who were the first Westerners to climb to the Jewish stronghold at Masada in 1842. Returning to America he became pastor of the Longmeadow, Massachusetts, Congregational Church in 1843. Between 1843 and 1853 he was among the principal speakers at temperance conventions. He became minister at Belchertown, Massachusetts in 1849; The High Street Congregational Church at Providence, Rhode Island in 1853; The New England Congregational Church of Chicago, Illinois, in 1859; and finally at Plymouth Congregational Church, Cleveland, Ohio, in 1862. He was at Chicago, Illinois, in 1860, with Harriet A., Samuel A., Henry R., Edward O., Harriet A., William E., Catherine E., Ann L., and Caroline G. Wolcott. Samuel was given an honorary STD degree by Marietta College, in 1863. During the Civil War, he went South with the U.S. Christian Commission. He was at Cleveland, Ohio, in 1870, with Harriett, Kate, Annie, Clara, Herbert, and Lottie. Samuel resigned his church ministry in 1874 to become Secretary of the Ohio Home Missionary Society. He was a minister at Cleveland, Ohio, in 1880. In 1880 Samuel Wolcott was on a delinquent tax list for Jacksonville, Illinois. He was the author of numerous religious tracts and hymns, the best known being, "Christ for the World we Sing", published in the 1892 hymnal of the Protestant Episcopal Church and subsequently in hymnals of many other denominations. He was the author of the 1st Wolcott Genealogy "The Wolcott Memorial" published in 1881. He is described as being tall in stature, with abundant white hair and beard. His sons in Denver built a fine home at Longmeadow, Massachusetts, for his retirement.
m. 5 SEP 1839 Westminster, Worcester Co., Massachusetts, Catharine Elizabeth Wood , b. 17 DEC 1812 Westminster, Worcester Co., Massachusetts, d. 26 OCT 1841 Beirut,, Syria.
(7) Samuel Wolcott (Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 JUL 1813 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 24 FEB 1886 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
Notes SAMUEL graduated from Yale College in 1833 and gave the Commencement Oration. He graduated from the Andover Theological Seminary in 1837, and was ordained in 1839. In 1837 his name is at the head of a number of Andover students who issued an anti-slavery manifesto. Samuel was a missionary to Syria from 1840 to 1843. He is said to have been one of two Americans who were the first Westerners to climb to the Jewish stronghold at Masada in 1842. Returning to America he became pastor of the Longmeadow, Massachusetts, Congregational Church in 1843. Between 1843 and 1853 he was among the principal speakers at temperance conventions. He became minister at Belchertown, Massachusetts in 1849; The High Street Congregational Church at Providence, Rhode Island in 1853; The New England Congregational Church of Chicago, Illinois, in 1859; and finally at Plymouth Congregational Church, Cleveland, Ohio, in 1862. He was at Chicago, Illinois, in 1860, with Harriet A., Samuel A., Henry R., Edward O., Harriet A., William E., Catherine E., Ann L., and Caroline G. Wolcott. Samuel was given an honorary STD degree by Marietta College, in 1863. During the Civil War, he went South with the U.S. Christian Commission. He was at Cleveland, Ohio, in 1870, with Harriett, Kate, Annie, Clara, Herbert, and Lottie. Samuel resigned his church ministry in 1874 to become Secretary of the Ohio Home Missionary Society. He was a minister at Cleveland, Ohio, in 1880. In 1880 Samuel Wolcott was on a delinquent tax list for Jacksonville, Illinois. He was the author of numerous religious tracts and hymns, the best known being, "Christ for the World we Sing", published in the 1892 hymnal of the Protestant Episcopal Church and subsequently in hymnals of many other denominations. He was the author of the 1st Wolcott Genealogy "The Wolcott Memorial" published in 1881. He is described as being tall in stature, with abundant white hair and beard. His sons in Denver built a fine home at Longmeadow, Massachusetts, for his retirement.
m. 1 NOV 1843 Millbury, Worcester Co., Massachusetts, Harriet Amanda Pope , b. 29 JUN 1821 Oxford, Worcester Co., Massachusetts, d. 5 FEB 1901 .
11 children: Samuel Adams, Henry Roger, Edward Oliver, Harriet Agnes, William Edgar, Katharine Ellen "Kate", Mary Alice, Anna Louisa, Clara Gertrude, Herbert Walter, Charlotte Augusta "Lottie",
(8) Samuel Adams Wolcott (Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 3 SEP 1844 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 1883 Encinal, Webb Co., Texas.
NotesSAMEL attended Yale College in the class of 1866, but left in his sophmore year to enter business. In 1869 he was in the paper business at New York City. about this time he purchased a ranch in Webb Co., Texas, on the Rio Grande River, north of Lorado, where he raised livestock.
m. 25 JUL 1883 Julia Ella Neal , b. Brooklyn, Kings Co., New York, d. .
1 children: Roger Henry.
(9) Roger Henry Wolcott (Samuel Adams Wolcott8, Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 JAN 1885 San Antonio, Bexar Co., Texas, d. 30 OCT 1948 Denver, Arapahoe County, After 1901 Denver Co., Colorado.
NotesROGER inherited the 10,000 volumn law library of his uncle, Edward Oliver Wolcott. Rover moved to Denver in 1905 and entered Denver Law School. He received an LLB degree from the University of Denver in 1907. He practiced law at Denver from 1907 to 1927, and was the first full time dean of the University of Denver law school 1928-1944, and afterward Dean Emeritus. He joined the Wolcott Society in 1948 as member #387, residing at Denver, Colorado.

1918 Draft Registration:
Roger Henry Wolcott 32, b. 12 Jan 1885, Denver, Denver, Colorado, lawyer, Wm. V. Hodges, wife Louise D. Wolcott, tall, medium build, gray eyes, light brown hair.
(8) Henry Roger Wolcott (Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 MAR 1846 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 31 MAY 1921 Honolulu, Honolulu Co., Hawaii.
NotesHENRY worked in two banks at Cleveland, Ohio. In 1864, he enlisted for 100 days service in a Cleveland Regiment that was sent to defend Washington. He then enlisted in the 143th Ohio Regiment until mustered out. He moved to Colorado in 1869, and tried mining and running a mill. In 1870 he was at Central City, Gilpin Co., Colorado. He became acting manager of the Boston & Colorado Smelting Co. at Black Hawk, becoming a stockholder and General Manager. He was also Secretary Treasurer of the Last Chance Mining and Milling Co. His brother, Edward, joined him in Colorado and the two became active in politics. He purchased land in Colorado in 1875, 1877, 1879, 1881,1888, 1890, 1893, and 1896. He was Colorado State Senator from Gilpin County from 1879 to 1882, and in 1881 was elected President of the Senate, and temporarily served as Acting Governor of Colorado. He was an unsuccessful Republican candidate for Governor in 1882 and 1896, and chairman of the state delegation to the 1888 Republican National Convention in Chicago. In 1887 he purchased a ranch at Bear Creek, Colorado. Henry was President of the Merchants National Bank of Denver, and Vice President of the First National Bank for ten years. He helped develop the Denver, Utah and Pacific Railroad and was its President. He was also a director of the Equitable Life Insurance Society. He built the observatory at Colorado College at Colorado Springs. Henry was given an honorary AM degree by Yale University in 1896, and by Colorado College in 1898. In 1905, the two brothers sailed to Europe where Edward died at Monte Carlo. Henry was living in Hawaii in 1916.
(8) Edward Oliver Wolcott (Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 26 MAR 1848 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 1 MAR 1905 Monte Carlo,, Monaco.
NotesEDWARD and his brother joined a boys military company in Chicago. In 1862 the family moved to Cleveland, where he enlisted in the 150th Ohio Voluntary Regiment in 1864. During that summer he was stationed near Washington, D. C., and was with the Regiment at the battle of Ft. Stevens. He attended Yale, and in 1871 graduated from Harvard Law School, receiving a LLD degree from Yale in 1896. In 1871 he went to Colorado to join his brother, Henry. Edward practiced law at Denver in 1880. He was active in the Republican party, and was elected United States Senator from the State of Colorado in 1889, serving until 1901. He was President of the Republican National Convention at Philadelphia in 1900. In 1890 Edward bought 500 acres of land 14 miles South of Denver. There he built a large 52 room home called "Wolhurst", in 1890, at a cost of 2 million dollars. He lavishly entertained prominent Americans and European royalty there. He left it to his brother, Henry, as he had no wife or children surviving. The home, used as the Wolhurst Saddle Club, burned down in 1951. In 1881 he bought mineral rights to 4 acres of land called "Wild Cat Lode" in Lake Co.. In 1882 he and others bought mineral rights called "The American Star Lode in Boulder Co. In 1889 he bought 160 acres of coal land at Gunnison and Pitkin Co. In 1896 he and the heirs of John T. Herrick, the heirs of Sam P. Rose, Joseph Strumpf bought mineral rights to 8 acres of land in Lake Co. called "Tenderfoot". He was a great gambler at Poker and Faro, and died while visiting the casino at Monte Carlo. His biograph, "Life and Character of Edward Oliver Wolcott" by Thomas Dawson, was privately printed. A large stained glass window with his picture was placed in the Colorado Senate. Known for his eloquence and culture, he was known locally as "Edward of Navarre" because of his patronage of the Navarre, a "house of ill repute".
m. 14 JUN 1899 Buffalo, Erie Co., New York, Frances Esther Metcalfe , b. Buffalo, Erie Co., New York, d. 9 FEB 1932 New York City, New York.
(8) Harriet Agnes Wolcott (Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 MAR 1850 Belchertown, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts, d. 1917 .
m. 2 APR 1879 , Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, Frederick Osni Vaille , b. 28 JUL 1850 Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 15 MAR 1939 .
3 children: Harriet Wolcott, Edith Wolcott, Agnes Wolcott.
(9) Harriet Wolcott Vaille (Harriet Agnes Wolcott8, Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 24 MAR 1880 Denver, Arapahoe Co., Colorado, d. 25 NOV 1962 .
NotesHARRIET graduated from Bryn Mawr College in 1910.
(9) Edith Wolcott Vaille (Harriet Agnes Wolcott8, Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 13 AUG 1882 Denver, Arapahoe Co., Colorado, d. MAY 1956 .
NotesEDITH graduated from Smith College in 1904.
(9) Agnes Wolcott Vaille (Harriet Agnes Wolcott8, Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 APR 1890 Denver, Arapahoe Co., Colorado, d. 12 JAN 1925 Long's Peak, Rocky Mountain National Park, Colorado.
NotesAGNES graduated from Smith College in 1912. She was an ardent rock climber and a member of the Colorado Mountain Club. Together with two other members she attempted to climb Long's Peak. One turned back and the other two reached the summit at 4 am in 14 degree below zero temperature. On the return trip Agnes fell 150 feet down a steep cliff. The other climber, Walter Kiener, reached her, but she was unable to continue and Kiener went for help. She died before she could be rescued. A stone shelter was built on the mountain at 13,200 feet as a memorial to her.
(8) William Edgar Wolcott (Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 26 APR 1852 Belchertown, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts, d. 12 MAY 1911 Lawrence, Essex Co., Massachusetts.
NotesWILLIAM graduated from Oberlin College in 1881, and was pastor of the Riverside Congregational Church at Lawrence, Massachusetts, for over 25 years. His large art collection, inherited from his brother, Senator Edward O. Wolcott, was left to the White Fund in 1911, to be placed in a museum in Lawrence when one could be built. William was an acquaintance of the poet, Robert Frost, who said, "Perhaps when that preacher looked me up after "My Butterfly" first appeared in print and talked to me about it, something Providential was happening to me. I'm sure the old gentleman didn't have the slightest idea he was having any effect on a very stubborn youngster who thought he knew what he knew. But something he said actually changed the whole course of my writing. It all became purposeful." William later recommended Frost for a teaching position. (From: Robert Frost, a Life", by Jay Parini.)
m. 26 MAR 1894 Cora Wadsworth , b. Of Methuen, Essex Co., Massachusetts, d. 25 SEP 1895 Lawrence, Essex Co., Massachusetts.
1 children: Samuel Wadsworth.
(9) Samuel Wadsworth Wolcott (William Edgar Wolcott8, Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 MAR 1895 Lawrence, Essex Co., Massachusetts, d. 1945 .
NotesSAMUEL was raised by his aunt Clara. He graduated from Williams College and Harvard Law School. He was a lawyer in Boston.
(8) Katharine Ellen "Kate" Wolcott (Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 AUG 1854 Providence, Providence Co., Rhode Island, d. 15 MAY 1936 Denver, Arapahoe County, After 1901 Denver Co., Colorado.
NotesKATHERINE was a bookeeper, living with her sister, Harriet, in 1880.
m. 25 NOV 1880 Denver, Arapahoe Co., Colorado, Charles Hansen Toll , b. 26 AUG 1850 Memphis, Onandago Co., New York, d. 4 DEC 1901 Denver, Arapahoe County, After 1901 Denver Co., Colorado.
4 children: Charles Hansen "Carl", Roger Wolcott, Henry Wolcott, Oliver Wolcott.
(9) Charles Hansen "Carl" Toll (Katharine Ellen "Kate" Wolcott8, Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 21 MAY 1882 Denver, Arapahoe County, After 1901 Denver Co., Colorado, d. .
NotesCHARLES served in the military during World War I. He was a professor at Amherst College and a genealogist.
(9) Roger Wolcott Toll (Katharine Ellen "Kate" Wolcott8, Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 OCT 1883 Denver, Arapahoe County, After 1901 Denver Co., Colorado, d. 25 FEB 1936 Deming, Luna Co., New Mexico.
NotesROGER graduated from Williams College, and served in the military during World War I. He was Superintendant of Yellowstone National Park. Roger was killed in an automobile accident.
(9) Henry Wolcott Toll (Katharine Ellen "Kate" Wolcott8, Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 5 NOV 1887 Denver, Arapahoe County, After 1901 Denver Co., Colorado, d. 17 OCT 1975 Denver, Arapahoe County, After 1901 Denver Co., Colorado.
NotesHENRY attended Williams College and Harvard Law School. He served in the military during World War II. He was a prominent Denver attorney, and served in the Colorado Senate in the 1920s. He was the founder of the Council of State Governments. The Toll Fellowship Program of the Council of State Governments is named for him. He joined the Wolcott Society in 1941 as member #236, residing at Denver, Colorado.
(9) Oliver Wolcott Toll (Katharine Ellen "Kate" Wolcott8, Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 3 AUG 1891 Denver, Arapahoe County, After 1901 Denver Co., Colorado, d. DEC 1981 .
NotesOLIVER graduated from Williams College in 1913 and the Harvard Law School in 1917. he served in the military during World War I. He was a lawyer and served in various role for the government, including the Nuremburg Trials. He was the author of "Arapaho Names and Trails; a Report of a 1914 Pack Trip", published in 1962.
(8) Mary Alice Wolcott (Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 24 JUL 1856 Providence, Providence Co., Rhode Island, d. 3 FEB 1858 .
(8) Anna Louisa Wolcott (Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 MAY 1858 Providence, Providence Co., Rhode Island, d. 17 AUG 1928 .
NotesANNA graduated from Wellesley College. She moved to Denver, Colorado in 1892 to be Principal of Wolfe Hall Episcopal School for Girls. In 1898 she founded the Wolcott School for Girls in Denver. She was a Regent of University of Colorado from 1910 to 1916, and a delegate to the Republican National Convention in 1923 and a member of the Republican National Committee in 1924. She was vice president of the Wolcott Society for Colorado in 1913.


"As Miss Anna Louise Wolcott she has been, for many years, one of the prominent educators of the state. Founded, and has sinee conducted, the Miss Wolcott School for Girls in Denver. A Regent of the State University since 1910; she is also one of the Board of Managers of the American School of Archacology. at Santa Fe. New Mexico. In January. 1913, she married Mr. Joel F. Vaile
m. JAN 1913 Joel Frederick Vaille , b. 1848 , d. 3 AUG 1916 King, San Bernardino Co., California.
(8) Clara Gertrude Wolcott (Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 DEC 1859 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois, d. DEC 1939 .
NotesCLARA graduated from Smith College in 1883.
(8) Herbert Walter Wolcott (Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 NOV 1861 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois, d. 28 NOV 1941 Los Angeles, Los Angeles Co., California.
NotesHERBERT graduated from Yale College in 1884. He became involved in the management of electric railroads in the Leavenworth, Ohio, area, where he was the first general manager of the Kansas City Leavenworth Electric Railroad Company. He was at Leavenworth in 1900. The power house of the railroad was located at Conner, Kansas, half way to Kansas City. Conner was renamed Wolcott in Herbert's honor in 1902. Herbert was a Republican and an Ohio state senator. In 1917 he was a large landowner in Texas. He gave the principal address at the 1920 Wolcott Society runion, and was President of the Society of Descendants of Henry Wolcott, 1922-1923.
m. 5 OCT 1891 Nettie M. Gabriel , b. , d. 24 JUN 1953 Buffalo, Erie Co., New York.
4 children: Mary Gabriel, Harriet Amanda, Edward Oliver, Henry Roger.
(9) Mary Gabriel Wolcott (Herbert Walter Wolcott8, Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 30 APR 1902 , d. .
NotesMARY graduated from Skidmore College. She lived at Pittsburg, Pennsylvania, in 1942.
(9) Harriet Amanda Wolcott (Herbert Walter Wolcott8, Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 22 JUL 1905 , d. .
NotesHARRIET graduated from Smith College.
(9) Edward Oliver Wolcott (Herbert Walter Wolcott8, Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 SEP 1911 , d. AUG 1912 .
(9) Henry Roger Wolcott (Herbert Walter Wolcott8, Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 AUG 1913 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, d. 4 DEC 1983 , Los Angeles Co., California.
NotesHENRY attended Yale University in the 1930s. He was at West Los Angeles in 1942. He lived at Pasadena, California, in 1954, when he joined the Wolcott Society as member #553.
(8) Charlotte Augusta "Lottie" Wolcott (Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 OCT 1863 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois, d. 16 APR 1912 Fort Leavenworth, Leavenworth Co., Kansas.
NotesCHARLOTTE graduated from Smith College in 1886.

(9) Roger Wolcott Bates (Charlotte Augusta "Lottie" Wolcott8, Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 28 DEC 1904 , d. .
NotesROGER graduated from Yale University in 1929. He was living in 1980 when he sold his father's papers to Yale University.

This or another Roger W. Bates was a World Life Master of Bridge in 1947.
(8) Charlotte Augusta "Lottie" Wolcott (Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 OCT 1863 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois, d. 16 APR 1912 Fort Leavenworth, Leavenworth Co., Kansas.

(8) Charlotte Augusta "Lottie" Wolcott (Samuel Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 OCT 1863 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois, d. 16 APR 1912 Fort Leavenworth, Leavenworth Co., Kansas.
NotesCHARLOTTE graduated from Smith College in 1886.
m. 26 MAR 1885 , Cook Co., Illinois, Robert C. Wright , b. , d. .
(7) Arthur Wolcott (Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 27 FEB 1815 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 28 NOV 1873 Keokuk, Lee Co., Iowa.
NotesARTHUR was a merchant at Keokuk, Iowa, in 1850. He was at Keokuk in 1860 with Clara B. and Sarah M. Wolcott. His burial record says he was born 10 April 1815.
m. 12 JUL 1849 Keokuk, Lee Co., Iowa, Sarah Ann Morrison , b. 10 DEC 1828 ,, Pennsylvania, d. 27 JAN 1851 .
1 children: Sarah Morrison.
(8) Sarah Morrison Wolcott (Arthur Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1850 , d. 7 FEB 1917 Capri, Isola Di Capri, Italy.
NotesSARAH was adopted by her aunt and took the name, Sarah Morrison Perry. At the time of her death, her niece, Kathryn Wolcott Perry, was living with her. She joined the Wolcott Society in 1915, residing at Capri, Italy.
(7) Arthur Wolcott (Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 27 FEB 1815 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 28 NOV 1873 Keokuk, Lee Co., Iowa.
NotesARTHUR was a merchant at Keokuk, Iowa, in 1850. He was at Keokuk in 1860 with Clara B. and Sarah M. Wolcott. His burial record says he was born 10 April 1815.
m. 1854 Keokuk, Lee Co., Iowa, Clara Belknap , b. ABT 1820 Newburgh, Orange Co., New York, d. 24 JAN 1906 Keokuk, Lee Co., Iowa.
3 children: Anne, Arthur Ellsworth, Bertha Belknap.
(8) Anne Wolcott (Arthur Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
(8) Arthur Ellsworth Wolcott (Arthur Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1861 ,, Iowa, d. 13 OCT 1862 .
NotesARTHUR died age 13 months, 13 days.
(8) Bertha Belknap Wolcott (Arthur Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 APR 1865 , d. .
(7) Elizur Wolcott (Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 7 AUG 1817 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 10 MAR 1901 Berkeley, Alameda Co., California.
NotesELIZUR graduated from Yale in 1839, was a early member of the "Skull and Bones" Society. He was educated as a physician, but engaged in Railroading and milling. He was roadmaster for the Wabash Railroad, and was a member of the Jacksonville, Illinois, City Council and Board of Education. In 1860 Eleizer Wolcot was a "gentleman" at Jacksonville, Illinois, age 42, with Martha 35, Eddie 9, and Elihu 5 mo. In 1870, he and wife and daughters Edith and May were living at Jacksonville, where he is described as a retired miller. He planned and carried out a city system of water-works for Jacksonville, and planned the Diamond Grove Cemetery.
m. 15 JUL 1846 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, Martha Lyman Dwight , b. 25 APR 1824 ,, Massachusetts, d. 9 JAN 1900 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
4 children: Leofwyn, Edith Dwight, Elihu, Mary Matoon.
(8) Leofwyn Wolcott (Elizur Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 NOV 1847 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. 7 AUG 1858 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
(8) Edith Dwight Wolcott (Elizur Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 18 DEC 1850 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. 16 NOV 1915 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
m. 22 DEC 1897 , Morgan Co., Illinois, John Herbert Davis , b. Of Lynchburg,, Virginia, d. .
(8) Elihu Wolcott (Elizur Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 30 DEC 1859 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. 29 AUG 1860 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
(8) Mary Matoon Wolcott (Elizur Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 MAY 1863 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. .

(9) Miriam Wolcott Clapp (Mary Matoon Wolcott8, Elizur Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 NOV 1890 ,, Illinois, d. .
(7) Frances Jane Wolcott (Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 30 MAR 1819 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 11 OCT 1871 Hot Springs, Garland Co., Arkansas.
Notes"My Beloved Wife, Frances Wolcott Lewis, a native of East Windsor, Conn., died at Hot Springs, Ark., October 11th (1831?, 1871?)
m. 2 JUN 1849 Mobile, Mobile Co., Alabama, Barbour Lewis , b. ABT 1814 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. .
(6) Elihu Wolcott (Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 FEB 1784 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 2 DEC 1858 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
NotesELIHU was a Representative to the Connecticut Legislature for East Windsor. He sold the family farm and moved to Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois in 1830. It was said that had a two room cabin, but that their furniture was shipped via New Orleans and did not arrive until the next spring. Elihu was a merchant and land owner. He purchased a large amount of land in 6 counties in Illinois between 1831 and 1849, including 952 acres at Orland Township, Cook Co., in 1835. In 1839 Elihu Woolcott of Morgan Co., Illinois, purchased 950acres of government land at Cook Co., Illinois, and 160 acres at Morgan Co., Illinois. He surveyed the route of the Sangamon and Morgan Railroad. Elihu was President of the Board of Trustees of the Jacksonville Female Academy in 1836. He ran as a candidate for Congress for the Liberty Party in 1846, against Abraham Lincoln and Cartwright. His estate was valued at $100,000. He won prizes at the 1853 Illinois State Fair for his cow and poultry. His son Elizur Wolcott was executor of his estate.
m. 13 MAY 1823 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Juliana Wolcott , b. 9 APR 1791 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 30 NOV 1832 .
3 children: Helen Maria, Julia Ann, Ellen Louise "Ella".
(7) Helen Maria Wolcott (Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 9 JUN 1824 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 13 MAY 1831 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(7) Julia Ann Wolcott (Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 JUN 1826 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 14 JUL 1910 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
NotesJULIA was a student at the Jacksonville Female Academy, graduating in 1845.
m. 19 NOV 1846 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, William Chauncy Carter , b. 2 APR 1820 New Canaan, Fairfield Co., Connecticut, d. 9 DEC 1896 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
9 children: Samuel Wolcott, William Chauncey, Edwin, William Wallace, Ella Marian, Walter Lee, Truman Post, Herbert, Helen Hooker.
(8) Samuel Wolcott Carter (Julia Ann Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 APR 1849 , Morgan Co., Illinois, d. .
NotesSAMUEL was a farmer at Joy Prarie.

NotesWILLIAM took over his father's farm in Morgan Co., Illinois.

m. 31 JUL 1894 Elizabeth Demotte , b. , d. .
3 children: Catharine Demotte, Roger Wolcott, Alice Elizabeth.
(9) Catharine Demotte Carter (Truman Post Carter8, Julia Ann Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 22 MAR 1898 , d. .
(9) Roger Wolcott Carter (Truman Post Carter8, Julia Ann Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 3 JUN 1900 , d. .
(9) Alice Elizabeth Carter (Truman Post Carter8, Julia Ann Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 18 AUG 1903 , d. .
(8) Herbert Carter (Julia Ann Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 11 OCT 1870 , Morgan Co., Illinois, d. 24 MAY 1899 Philadelphia, Philadelphia Co., Pennsylvania.
NotesHERBERT graduated from Illinois College in 1892, and from Hahnemann Medical College in Philadelphia in 1895. He had a druggist business in Jacksonville for a few yearsm and then returned to Philadelphia to study diseases of the nose and throat.
(8) Helen Hooker Carter (Julia Ann Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 11 OCT 1870 , Morgan Co., Illinois, d. 11 JUN 1871 .
(7) Ellen Louise "Ella" Wolcott (Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 4 JUN 1828 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 15 APR 1912 Elmira, Chemung Co., New York.
NotesELLEN had a dermatalogical illness and spent much time undergoing various cures. After the death of her father she had financial problems. She worked for the Sanitary Comission as a nurse during the Civil War, where she was a correspondent of Dorthea Dix. After the war she was a librarian at Elmira, New York. In 1880 she was living alone at Elmira. Her letters and papers are in the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, at the University of Connecticut Library. Ellen L. Wolcott of Elmira, New York, is reported deceased in the 1912 Society report, and is described as "a loyal member of the society from its beginning."
m. McVaugh , b. , d. .
1 children: Archie.
(8) Archie McVaugh (Ellen Louise "Ella" Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. 28 JUN 1912 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
NotesARCHIE was killed.
(6) Elihu Wolcott (Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 FEB 1784 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 2 DEC 1858 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
NotesELIHU was a Representative to the Connecticut Legislature for East Windsor. He sold the family farm and moved to Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois in 1830. It was said that had a two room cabin, but that their furniture was shipped via New Orleans and did not arrive until the next spring. Elihu was a merchant and land owner. He purchased a large amount of land in 6 counties in Illinois between 1831 and 1849, including 952 acres at Orland Township, Cook Co., in 1835. In 1839 Elihu Woolcott of Morgan Co., Illinois, purchased 950acres of government land at Cook Co., Illinois, and 160 acres at Morgan Co., Illinois. He surveyed the route of the Sangamon and Morgan Railroad. Elihu was President of the Board of Trustees of the Jacksonville Female Academy in 1836. He ran as a candidate for Congress for the Liberty Party in 1846, against Abraham Lincoln and Cartwright. His estate was valued at $100,000. He won prizes at the 1853 Illinois State Fair for his cow and poultry. His son Elizur Wolcott was executor of his estate.
m. 17 SEP 1835 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Sarah Choate Crocker , b. 17 AUG 1797 , d. 4 AUG 1844 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
2 children: Sarah Elizabeth, Richmond,
(7) Sarah Elizabeth Wolcott (Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 MAY 1837 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. 6 SEP 1838 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
(7) Richmond Wolcott (Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 JAN 1840 , Morgan Co., Illinois, d. 14 MAY 1908 Springfield, Sangamon Co., Illinois.
NotesRICHMOND gratuated from Illinois College in 1859. He was living at Morgan Co., Illinois, in 1860, with the Kirby family, and listed on the census as a physician. He enlisted as a Private in Co. B, 10th Illinois Infantry in 1861. In April 1861 he was a hospital steward at Jacksonville. He was later comissioned a Lieutenant, and then promoted to Captain. He was discharged in September, 1864. He was admitted to the bar in June 1865, and was a lawyer at Springfield, Illinois, where he was living with Jennie, Cordelia, and Lucy in 1880. He was one of the organizers and the first Secretary of the Illinois Sons of the American Revolution in 1889. Richmond wrote short stories, several of which were published in books and magazines in the 1860s. In 1870 Richmond Wolcott of Sagamon Co., Illinois, purchased 160 acres of government land at Otter Tail Co., Minnesota, and 12 acres at Grant Co., Minnesota.
m. 11 JUL 1865 , Sangamon Co., Illinois, Jane Van Vechten "Jennie" Satler , b. 17 OCT 1841 Waverly,, Illinois, d. 9 FEB 1920 St. Louis, St. Louis Co., Missouri.
3 children: Cordelia Leland, Lucy Salter, Ella Richmond.
(8) Cordelia Leland Wolcott (Richmond Wolcott7, Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 9 MAY 1866 Springfield, Sangamon Co., Illinois, d. .
NotesCORDELIA was DAR member #63448 of Bloomington.

(7) Richmond Wolcott (Elihu Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 JAN 1840 , Morgan Co., Illinois, d. 14 MAY 1908 Springfield, Sangamon Co., Illinois.
NotesRICHMOND gratuated from Illinois College in 1859. He was living at Morgan Co., Illinois, in 1860, with the Kirby family, and listed on the census as a physician. He enlisted as a Private in Co. B, 10th Illinois Infantry in 1861. In April 1861 he was a hospital steward at Jacksonville. He was later comissioned a Lieutenant, and then promoted to Captain. He was discharged in September, 1864. He was admitted to the bar in June 1865, and was a lawyer at Springfield, Illinois, where he was living with Jennie, Cordelia, and Lucy in 1880. He was one of the organizers and the first Secretary of the Illinois Sons of the American Revolution in 1889. Richmond wrote short stories, several of which were published in books and magazines in the 1860s. In 1870 Richmond Wolcott of Sagamon Co., Illinois, purchased 160 acres of government land at Otter Tail Co., Minnesota, and 12 acres at Grant Co., Minnesota.

NotesWOLCOTT graduated from the Naval Academy in 1906, and was comissioned an Ensign. He became a captain in the U. S. Navy, serving in World War I and II. He was made Cdr. in 1928. In 1940 he lived at Annapolis, Maryland.

NotesROGER graduated from Yale College in 1911, and received his law degree from Yale in 1913. He practiced law ar Hartford and was an alderman at Hartford from 1917 to 1919. He moved to Windsor, Connecticut, where he practiced law and became a judge.

NotesELLEN was born Sophia and her given name was changed to Ellen in childhood.

(7) Ellsworth (Sophia Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1825 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. ABT 1825 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(7) Henry Martin Ellsworth (Sophia Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 29 APR 1827 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 21 OCT 1829 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(6) Ursula Wolcott (Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 NOV 1788 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1 JUN 1868 .
NotesURSULA lived at East Windsor, Connecticut, in 1840.
m. 10 MAY 1815 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Newton Skinner , b. 10 OCT 1782 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 3 MAR 1825 New Britain, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
3 children: Mary Gay, Samuel Wolcott, Ann Grant.
(7) Mary Gay Skinner (Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 FEB 1818 New Britain, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 26 OCT 1898 .
m. 6 OCT 1840 Aaron Russell Livermore , b. 6 OCT 1810 Mansfield, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. East Haven, New Haven Co., Connecticut.
3 children: Russell Wolcott, Charles Herbert, Mary H..
(8) Russell Wolcott Livermore (Mary Gay Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 9 FEB 1849 Mansfield, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 21 APR 1914 Pates, Robeson Co., North Carolina.
NotesRUSSELL received a BA degreee from the Massachusetts Agricultural College in 1872 and graduated from the Yale School of Lawe in 1875. He was a lawyer at New Haven for 2 years and then moved to Toledo, Ohio, where he practiced law for 6 years. He then moved to North Carolina to assist his wife's brother, and settled at Pates where he was a cotton planter, merchant, and dealer in turpentine and naval supplies.
m. 5 MAY 1880 Toledo, Lucas Co., Ohio, Elizabeth Taylor Hayes , b. , d. .
3 children: Mary Hoyland, Henry Wolcott, Russell Hayes.
(9) Mary Hoyland Livermore (Russell Wolcott Livermore8, Mary Gay Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 11 OCT 1883 , Robeson Co., North Carolina, d. 1 JAN 1965 Fayetteville, Cumberland Co., North Carolina.
NotesMARY was a social worker.
(9) Henry Wolcott Livermore (Russell Wolcott Livermore8, Mary Gay Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
(9) Russell Hayes Livermore (Russell Wolcott Livermore8, Mary Gay Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
(8) Charles Herbert Livermore (Mary Gay Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 OCT 1856 Mansfield, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 20 OCT 1928 Monterey, Monterey Co., California.
NotesCHARLES received a BA degree from Yale in 1879; was teacher and principal of Guilford Institute, Guilford, Connecticut, 1879-1883. He received his PhD. from of Johns Hopkins University in 1886. He was a university fellow in history, 1884-1885; instructor in History and German at Hopkins Grammar School, New Haven, Connecticut, 1885-1886; instructor in History at the University of California, 1886-1888; Professor of History at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Boston, 1888-1893; Principal of Adelphia Academy, Brooklyn, New York, 1893-1896 and elected President of Adelphi College in 1896. He was the winner of $50,000 for the Bok Peace Prize in 1924.
m. Mettie Norton Tuttle , b. , d. .
2 children: George Kirchway, Henry Wolcott.
(9) George Kirchway Livermore (Charles Herbert Livermore8, Mary Gay Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 18 APR 1891 Brookline, Norfolk Co., Massachusetts, d. .
NotesGEORGE was a Lieutenant and an instructor at an Artillery school in France in 1918.
(9) Henry Wolcott Livermore (Charles Herbert Livermore8, Mary Gay Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
NotesHENRY, of Hartford, Connecticut, served in Bttry. A, 135th Field Arty. Regt. in France in 1918.
(8) Mary H. Livermore (Mary Gay Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1851 ,, Connecticut, d. .
NotesMARY was a school teacher, living with her parents at East Haven, Connecticut, in 1880. She lived at Hartford, Connecticut, in 1918.
(7) Samuel Wolcott Skinner (Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 19 JUN 1820 New Britain, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 16 AUG 1903 Toledo, Lucas Co., Ohio.
NotesSAMUEL received a BA degree from Yale College in 1842 and a MA degree in 1846. He was liscenced as a medical doctor in 1846. He was Divison Surgeon with the 1st Connecticut Artillery at Arlington Virginia, from 1861 to 1865, during the Civil War. In 1866 he moved to Toledo, Ohio, where he had a medical practice. He served as the Toledo Health Officer and consulting surgeon for St. Vincent Hospital.
m. 16 SEP 1846 Dorianna Fuller , b. 18 OCT 1823 , d. 17 MAR 1919 Toledo, Lucas Co., Ohio.
5 children: Helen Wolcott, Alice Fuller, Edward Bissell, Roger Wolcott, Samuel Wolcott.
(8) Helen Wolcott Skinner (Samuel Wolcott Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 21 SEP 1847 , d. 8 JUN 1935 .
m. 2 JUN 1875 Charles M. Dimmick , b. , d. .
(8) Alice Fuller Skinner (Samuel Wolcott Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 24 FEB 1849 Windsor Locks, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 24 MAR 1919 .
m. 6 OCT 1868 Toledo, Lucas Co., Ohio, John Hardy Doyle , b. 23 APR 1844 Mundy Creek, Perry Co., Ohio, d. 24 MAR 1919 Mundy Creek, Perry Co., Ohio.
6 children: Elizabeth Wolcott, Grace Alice, John Hardy, Frederick Ellsworth, Roger Wolcott, Helen Genevieve.
(9) Elizabeth Wolcott Doyle (Alice Fuller Skinner8, Samuel Wolcott Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 7 AUG 1873 Toledo, Lucas Co., Ohio, d. JUN 1939 Toledo, Lucas Co., Ohio.
NotesELIZABETH joined the Wolcott Society as member 96 in 1930, residing at Innisfail, Toledo, Ohio.
(9) Grace Alice Doyle (Alice Fuller Skinner8, Samuel Wolcott Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 NOV 1873 Toledo, Lucas Co., Ohio, d. 1933 .
NotesGRACE joined the Wolcott Society in 1925 as member #98, residing at Toledo,Ohio.

(8) Edward Bissell Skinner (Samuel Wolcott Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 24 FEB 1852 , d. 1 MAY 1929 .
NotesEDWARD was a bookkeeper for MacLaren & Sprague.
m. 10 JAN 1877 Rose S. Jones , b. 13 MAR 1855 , d. 4 JUN 1933 .
4 children: Newton E., Helen E., Roger Wolcott, David Howe.
(9) Newton E. Skinner (Edward Bissell Skinner8, Samuel Wolcott Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 4 JAN 1877 , d. .
(9) Helen E. Skinner (Edward Bissell Skinner8, Samuel Wolcott Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 SEP 1880 , d. .

(9) David Howe Skinner (Edward Bissell Skinner8, Samuel Wolcott Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 23 JUN 1892 , d. .
(8) Roger Wolcott Skinner (Samuel Wolcott Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 MAY 1857 , d. 24 MAY 1857 .
(8) Samuel Wolcott Skinner (Samuel Wolcott Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 8 OCT 1861 , d. 25 SEP 1891 .
NotesSamuel was bookeeper for the Milburn Wagon Works at Toledo.
m. 10 JUN 1890 Lillian Bishop , b. , d. .
(7) Ann Grant Skinner (Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 23 AUG 1823 New Britain, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 5 JUN 1893 .
m. 19 OCT 1848 East Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Sylvester Hine , b. , d. .
(6) Elizabeth Wolcott (Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 23 SEP 1791 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 7 FEB 1873 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. 23 NOV 1820 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Erastus Ellsworth , b. 20 JAN 1790 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 30 APR 1879 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
5 children: Erastus Wolcott, Elizabeth, , Mary Lyman, Josiah Leavitt.
(7) Erastus Wolcott Ellsworth (Elizabeth Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 27 NOV 1822 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 5 JAN 1902 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesERASTUS graduated from Amhurst College in 1844 and studied law but was never admitted to the bar. He was a poet and an inventor. In 1845 he obtained a patent for a drawing or copying instrument, and for a device for making a siphon discharge at its highest point. One of his poems, "What is the Use", was published in "An American Anthology", by Edmund Steadman. Erastus engraved some of the pictures that appeared in "The Wolcott Memorial".
(7) Elizabeth Ellsworth (Elizabeth Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 7 APR 1824 New York City, New York, d. 7 DEC 1825 New York City, New York.
(7) Ellsworth (Elizabeth Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1826 New York City, New York, d. INFANT .
(7) Mary Lyman Ellsworth (Elizabeth Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 NOV 1827 New York City, New York, d. .
m. 9 NOV 1848 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, William Wood , b. ABT 1823 Waterbury, New Haven Co., Connecticut, d. 9 AUG 1884 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
2 children: Elizabeth Ellsworth, William Russell.
(8) Elizabeth Ellsworth Wood (Mary Lyman Ellsworth7, Elizabeth Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 31 AUG 1849 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
m. 9 NOV 1878 Lewis Sperry , b. 23 JAN 1848 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
2 children: Mary Elizabeth, Ellsworth.
(9) Mary Elizabeth Sperry (Elizabeth Ellsworth Wood8, Mary Lyman Ellsworth7, Elizabeth Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 JAN 1880 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
(9) Ellsworth Sperry (Elizabeth Ellsworth Wood8, Mary Lyman Ellsworth7, Elizabeth Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 JUN 1881 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
(8) William Russell Wood (Mary Lyman Ellsworth7, Elizabeth Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 9 JUN 1859 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
(7) Josiah Leavitt Ellsworth (Elizabeth Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 MAY 1829 New York City, New York, d. 25 APR 1832 New York City, New York.
(6) Horace Wolcott (Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 MAR 1794 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1838 , Morgan Co., Illinois.
NotesHORACE was Captain of a cavalry unit at South Windsor. He moved first to Michigan, where he was a petitioner at Monroe Co. in 1831 and 1834, and later to Illinois, where he died. Horace Wolcott of Hartford Co., Connecticut purchased 279 acres of government land at Lenawee Co., Michigan, in 1825, where he was a fur trader. Horace Wolcott of Monroe Co., Michigan, purchased 3 acres of land at Wayne Co., Michigan, in 1825. An additional patent for 80 acres of land in Lenawee Co., issued in 1825, was confirmed in 1931. His brother, Elihu, was administrator of his estate.
(5) Arodi Wolcott (Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 29 SEP 1760 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 18 MAY 1805 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. DEC 1789 , Hartford Co., Connecticut, Ruth Pitkin , b. 1764 East Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1 AUG 1811 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
4 children: Arodi Pitkin, Almira, , Mary.
(6) Arodi Pitkin Wolcott (Arodi Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 JUN 1791 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 30 DEC 1842 .
(6) Almira Wolcott (Arodi Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 13 AUG 1793 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 25 FEB 1865 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesALMIRA's grave stone says she died 27 Feb. 1865, age 71. She and her sister, Mary, raised Julia, daughter of Simon and Betsy Loomis of South Windsor. Julia married Zenas Rider of Springfield, Massachusetts.
(6) Wolcott (Arodi Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 24 DEC 1795 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 24 DEC 1795 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(6) Mary Wolcott (Arodi Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 APR 1797 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 17 MAR 1858 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. Russell Cone , b. , d. .
(5) Albert Wolcott (Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 19 DEC 1761 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
NotesALBERT lived in the home built by his grandfather, Gov. Roger Wolcott, in 1704. He was at East Windsor, Connecticut in 1790, with a family of 1 male over 16, 1 male under 16, and 4 females. He was at Hartford Co. in 1810 with 1 male over 45 (Albert), 2 females 16-25 (Hannah & Cynthia), and 1 female 10-15 (Elizabeth). Following the death of his wife and only son, Albert and his four daughters, Cynthia, Hannah, Laura, and Elizabeth, moved to Cleveland, Ohio, in 1816. He brought with him the family Bible of his grandfather, Gov. Roger Wolcott, which was later deposited by his grandson, Stoughton Bliss, with the the Hartford, Connecticut, museum.
m. 26 APR 1786 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Hannah Loomis , b. 29 JUL 1765 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 11 JAN 1807 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
6 children: Hannah, Albert, Cynthia, Laura, Laura, Elizabeth "Betsey".
(6) Hannah Wolcott (Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 19 MAY 1786 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 10 MAY 1855 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
(6) Albert Wolcott (Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 NOV 1787 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 24 MAR 1810 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. Hannah Moore , b. ABT 1790 , d. ABT 1832 .
(6) Cynthia Wolcott (Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 SEP 1789 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1848 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
m. 16 MAY 1813 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, William Bliss , b. 3 JAN 1790 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 8 SEP 1828 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
5 children: Albert Wolcott, Nancy Eliza, Louisa, Stoughton, William Samuel,
(7) Albert Wolcott Bliss (Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 8 MAR 1814 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 14 NOV 1849 Warren, Trumbull Co., Ohio.
m. 6 AUG 1846 Maria Harsh , b. , d. .
1 children: Albert Harsh.
(8) Albert Harsh Bliss (Albert Wolcott Bliss7, Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 22 JUL 1847 Warren, Trumbull Co., Ohio, d. 1 FEB 1852 .
(7) Nancy Eliza Bliss (Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 JAN 1817 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, d. 17 SEP 1842 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
(7) Louisa Bliss (Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 JUN 1819 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, d. .
NotesLOUISA was born blind, and after her father's death was cared for by a cousin, Nancy Warner, Mrs. Proctor Pease, living in Michigan.
(7) Stoughton Bliss (Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 18 FEB 1823 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, d. Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
NotesSTOUGHTON remained unmarried after the death of his wife. He lived at the Kennard House hotel at Cleveland. He is said to have strongly resembled Oliver Wolcott, signer of the Declaration of Independence.
m. 1849 Maria Ann Sweet , b. 1826 Buffalo, Columbia Co., New York, d. 1850 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
(7) William Samuel Bliss (Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 5 MAY 1827 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, d. 1881 Glenville, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
NotesSAMUEL moved from Columbia, Tennessee, to Cleveland, Ohio, in 1872. In 1880 he was a newspaper publisher at Franklin, Indiana, but returned to Ohio where he died in 1881.
m. 17 DEC 1851 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, Lucy A. Gurley , b. , d. .
1 children: Lizzie.
(8) Lizzie Bliss (William Samuel Bliss7, Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 28 SEP 1852 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, d. 28 NOV 1852 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
(7) William Samuel Bliss (Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 5 MAY 1827 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, d. 1881 Glenville, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
NotesSAMUEL moved from Columbia, Tennessee, to Cleveland, Ohio, in 1872. In 1880 he was a newspaper publisher at Franklin, Indiana, but returned to Ohio where he died in 1881.
m. 1865 Anna Maria Johnson , b. 1840 Stroupsville, Trumbull Co., Ohio, d. 1926 Berea, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
2 children: Harry Alfred, Maria Louise.
(8) Harry Alfred Bliss (William Samuel Bliss7, Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 3 AUG 1867 Columbia, Maury Co., Tennessee, d. 11 DEC 1937 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
NotesHARRY was an amateur musician and played several instruments. He played at many affairs in the Cleveland area. He was President of the Bliss Supply Co. Mrs. Harry A. Bliss of Cleveland attended the 1914 Wolcott reunion, but the Blisses are not listed on the Society membership list until 1917. Harry was Ohio state vice president in 1918, and the 14th President of the Society of Descendants of Henry Wolcot, 1925-26.
m. 31 AUG 1910 L. Blanche "Blanche" Fisher , b. 11 AUG 1879 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, d. 1953 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
2 children: Wolcott, Imogene Fisher.
(9) Wolcott Bliss (Harry Alfred Bliss8, William Samuel Bliss7, Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. INFANT .
(9) Imogene Fisher Bliss (Harry Alfred Bliss8, William Samuel Bliss7, Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 24 FEB 1918 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, d. 14 JAN 2003 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
NotesIMOGENE attended Mt. Vernon Seminary and the Connecticut College for Women. She went to New York City in the 1960s where she was a Broadway and movie actress, appearing in THe King of Marvin Gardens, 1972 and Stone Pillow 1985, and in the Broadway shows The Women and Grease. She joined the Wolcott Society in 1918, residing at Cleveland, Ohio.
(8) Maria Louise Bliss (William Samuel Bliss7, Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 11 JUL 1871 Columbia, Maury Co., Tennessee, d. .
NotesMARIA lived at LaGrange, Illinois.
m. 28 MAR 1894 Wellington, Lorain Co., Ohio, Charles Phelps Horr , b. 20 JAN 1868 Lorain, Lorain Co., Ohio, d. 14 MAR 1936 La Grange, Cook Co., Illinois.
2 children: Cortland Bliss, Louise Bliss.
(9) Cortland Bliss Horr (Maria Louise Bliss8, William Samuel Bliss7, Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. La Grange, Cook Co., Illinois, d. .
NotesCORTLAND joined the Wolcott Society in 1920, residing at La Grange, Ohio.
(9) Louise Bliss Horr (Maria Louise Bliss8, William Samuel Bliss7, Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 AUG 1902 Philadelphia, Philadelphia Co., Pennsylvania, d. 10 MAY 1966 LaGrange, DuPage Co., Illinois.
(6) Laura Wolcott (Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 3 MAR 1793 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 20 SEP 1793 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(6) Laura Wolcott (Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 NOV 1794 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 24 DEC 1795 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(6) Elizabeth "Betsey" Wolcott (Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 30 OCT 1797 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
(4) Ursula Wolcott (Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 30 OCT 1724 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 5 APR 1788 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut.
NotesURSULA was pictured in Ripley's "Believe It or Not" newspaper column because her father, brother, husband, son, and nephew were all Governors.
m. 10 NOV 1743 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Matthew Griswold , b. 25 MAR 1714 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 28 APR 1799 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut.
8 children: Ursula, Hannah, Marian, John, Ursula, Matthew, Roger, Sally,
(5) Ursula Griswold (Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 18 NOV 1744 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 14 FEB 1745 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut.
(5) Hannah Griswold (Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 APR 1746 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 15 DEC 1755 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut.
(5) Marian Griswold (Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 APR 1750 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 17 JUN 1829 West Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
NotesMARIAN was considered a very beautiful, brilliant and outspoken woman. When Justin Ely, who became her 3rd husband, proposed marriage she replied, "Oh, I could not think of burying another husband." She died 12 years after him. Account books of the store and farm at Woodstock, Connecticut begun by her first husband were kept by Marion until 1811.
m. 28 SEP 1769 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, Charles Church Chandler , b. 11 JAN 1746 Woodstock, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. 9 AUG 1787 Woodstock, Windham Co., Connecticut.
9 children: Dorothy Church, Samuel, Marion, Ursula, Charles, Hannah, Sally, Esther, Elizabeth.
(6) Dorothy Church Chandler (Marian Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 19 AUG 1770 Woodstock, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. .
m. James Backus , b. 11 JUL 1764 , d. .
(6) Samuel Chandler (Marian Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1771 Woodstock, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. 16 JUN 1782 Woodstock, Windham Co., Connecticut.
(6) Marion Chandler (Marian Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 29 JUL 1774 Woodstock, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. .
m. James Lanman , b. , d. .
(6) Ursula Chandler (Marian Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 DEC 1776 Woodstock, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. .
m. Harvey Frink , b. , d. .
(6) Charles Chandler (Marian Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1779 Woodstock, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. 19 SEP 1787 Woodstock, Windham Co., Connecticut.

(5) Marian Griswold (Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 APR 1750 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 17 JUN 1829 West Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
NotesMARIAN was considered a very beautiful, brilliant and outspoken woman. When Justin Ely, who became her 3rd husband, proposed marriage she replied, "Oh, I could not think of burying another husband." She died 12 years after him. Account books of the store and farm at Woodstock, Connecticut begun by her first husband were kept by Marion until 1811.
m. ABT 1790 Ebenezer Lane , b. 10 FEB 1747 Attleboro, Bristol Co., Massachusetts, d. 21 JUN 1806 .
1 children: Ebenezer.
(6) Ebenezer Lane (Marian Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 SEP 1793 Northampton, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts, d. 12 JUN 1866 Sandusky, Erie Co., Ohio.
NotesEBENEZER was Chief Justice of Ohio.

Ebenezer and Frances were first cousins.
m. 11 OCT 1818 Frances Ann Griswold , b. 15 JAN 1795 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. .
1 children: William Griswold.
(7) William Griswold Lane (Ebenezer Lane6, Marian Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 FEB 1824 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 28 OCT 1877 Sandusky, Erie Co., Ohio.

(9) Elizabeth Diodate Griswold Moss (Elizabeth Griswold Lane8, William Griswold Lane7, Ebenezer Lane6, Marian Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 21 NOV 1879 Sandusky, Erie Co., Ohio, d. 4 MAR 1960 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut.
(8) Sarah Spencer Lane (William Griswold Lane7, Ebenezer Lane6, Marian Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 5 MAR 1853 Sandusky, Erie Co., Ohio, d. 19 JAN 1935 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut.
(8) Wolcott Griswold Lane (William Griswold Lane7, Ebenezer Lane6, Marian Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 24 JAN 1866 Sandusky, Erie Co., Ohio, d. 11 NOV 1956 .
NotesWOLCOTT graduated from Yale University with a degree in law in 1888. He was a lawyer and argued before the New York Surogate Court. He was one of the Executors of the will of William Augustus Spencer who died in the sinking of the Titanic in 1912, as well as executor for Williams brother, Lorrilard Spencer. His transcripts of the papers of Roger Griswold are in the Connecticut Historical Society.

NotesWOLCOTT graduated from Yale University with a degree in law in 1888. He was a lawyer and argued before the New York Surogate Court. He was one of the Executors of the will of William Augustus Spencer who died in the sinking of the Titanic in 1912, as well as executor for Williams brother, Lorrilard Spencer. His transcripts of the papers of Roger Griswold are in the Connecticut Historical Society.
(8) Charles Chandler Griswold Lane (Elizabeth Diodate Griswold7, Charles Chandler Griswold6, John Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 DEC 1867 Sandusky, Erie Co., Ohio, d. 7 MAY 1896 ,, New York.
(7) Sarah Johnson Griswold (Charles Chandler Griswold6, John Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 7 MAY 1827 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. .
m. 30 JUN 1847 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, Lorillard Spencer , b. 1826 New York City, New York, d. 1888 Paris, Seine, France.
7 children: Elvira, William Augustus, George Griswold, Charles, Eleanora, Lydia, Lorillard.
(8) Elvira Spencer (Sarah Johnson Griswold7, Charles Chandler Griswold6, John Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1850 ,, New York, d. .
(8) William Augustus Spencer (Sarah Johnson Griswold7, Charles Chandler Griswold6, John Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 7 JAN 1855 New York City, New York, d. 15 APR 1912 North Bolton Cemetery, North Bolton, Tolland Co., Connecticut.
NotesWILLIAM was raised and educated in Europe. He became a New York socialite and bibliophile. He and his wife Marie boarded the "Titanic" as 1st Class Passenger at Cherbough on Wednesday April 10th, 1912. They had ticket No. 17569, cost 146 10s 10d, and Cabin No. B78. Marie survied the sinking in boat 6 and was picked up by the "Carpathia" and disembarked at New York City on Thursday, April 18th, 1912.

"William Augustus Spencer, who was drowned when the Titanic sank on April 15,1912, left a net estate of $2,218,650, according to an appraisal filed yesterday. The beneficiaries are Mrs. Marie Eugenie Spencer, his widow, $1,273,071; Lorillard Spencer, his nephew, $396,683; the New York Public Library, $394,095; and Eleanora L. S. Cenci, Princess de Vicovaro, his sister, $50,000. Mr. Spencer's estate was made up of these assets: Real estate, $893,622; bank accounts, $122,200; household goods, furniture, books, and pictures at his Throgs Neck Farm in the Bronx, $1,088; a half share in a ruby ring, $2,500; bonds and mortgages, $332,085; stocks and bonds, $932,016, and commissions due as the executor of other estates, $48,573. A claim for $2,670 against the owners of the Titanic for personal property which went down with the steamer was appraised at not more than $500. Included in Mr. Spencer's bequest to the New York Public Library was a library composed chiefly of French books. These were appraised at $40,779. Some of the volumes were: "Une Femme de Qualit au Sicle Pass," by Maurice Leloir, $4,000; "Ftes Galantes," by Paul Verlaine, $2,000; "La Dame de Monsereau," by Alexandre Dumas, $1,500; "La Vengeance des Peaux de Bique," by Gustave Toudouze, $1,400: "The Lady of Shalott," by Alfred Tennyson, $1,000; "La Reliure du XIXe Sicle," by Henri Beraldi, $1,000; "La Tribu Indienne," by Lucien Bonaparte, $1,000; "Pastels Tirages Successifs," by P. Bourget, $1,000; "Histoire d'un Epingle," by Segur, $800; "Jacques le Fataliste et son Maitre," by D. Diderot, $750; "La Mouche," by Alfred de Musset, $720; "Daphnis and Chloe," by Longus, $720; "Les Contes Drolatiques," by Honor de Balzac, $700; "Notre Dame de Paris," by Victor Hugo, $650; "The Three Musketeers," by Alexandre Dumas, $600; and "Zadig ou le Destine," by Voltaire, $600. Mr. Spencer owned this real estate: 183 Water Street, $20,000; 37 Allen Street, $20,500; 395 Grand Street, $30,000; 181-185 Forsyth Street, $66,000; 100 West Seventy-seventh Street, $70,000; 2,046-2,050 Seventh Avenue, $72,000; Throgs Neck Farm, the Bronx, $445,500; Williamsbridge Farm, the Bronx, $240,000; interest in property on Pelham Parkway, the Bronx, $12,400. Mortgages and taxes reduced the net value of the realty to $893,622." New York Times, 10 July 1914.
m. Marie Eugenie , b. 1867 Paris, Seine, France, d. 26 OCT 1913 Paris, Seine, France.
(8) George Griswold Spencer (Sarah Johnson Griswold7, Charles Chandler Griswold6, John Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1856 New York City, New York, d. .
(8) Charles Spencer (Sarah Johnson Griswold7, Charles Chandler Griswold6, John Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1857 ,, New York, d. .

(8) Lorillard Spencer (Sarah Johnson Griswold7, Charles Chandler Griswold6, John Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 FEB 1860 New York City, New York, d. 14 MAR 1912 New York City, New York.
m. ABT 3 OCT 1882 Caroline Suydam Berryman , b. 28 DEC 1861 New Haven, New Haven Co., Connecticut, d. 6 APR 1948 Newport, Newport Co., Rhode Island.
1 children: Lorillard.
(9) Lorillard Spencer (Lorillard Spencer8, Sarah Johnson Griswold7, Charles Chandler Griswold6, John Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 4 JUL 1883 New York City, New York, d. 9 JUN 1939 Newport, Newport Co., Rhode Island.
NotesLORILLARD received $396,683 in 1914 from the estate of his uncle, William Augustus Spencer who when down with the "Titanic" on 15 April 1912.
(5) Ursula Griswold (Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 13 APR 1754 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 27 NOV 1781 .
m. 22 NOV 1777 Lynde McCurdy , b. 4 APR 1755 , d. NOV 1804 .
2 children: Ursula, John.
(6) Ursula McCurdy (Ursula Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 AUG 1778 , d. ABT 1819 .
m. John Allen , b. 12 JUN 1763 , d. 31 JUL 1812 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut.
1 children: John,
(7) John Allen (Ursula McCurdy6, Ursula Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1802 , d. 1887 Washington, District of Columbia.
NotesJOHN moved from Litchfield to study law at Cleveland, Ohio, under Judge Samuel Cowles, about 1825. He was admitted to the Cleveland bar, and was the last president of the village council. When Cleveland became a city he was mayor and postmaster, state Senator, Representative to Congress, banker, and railroad director.
m. Warren, Trumbull Co., Ohio, Anna Maria Perkins , b. , d. .
(7) John Allen (Ursula McCurdy6, Ursula Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1802 , d. 1887 Washington, District of Columbia.
NotesJOHN moved from Litchfield to study law at Cleveland, Ohio, under Judge Samuel Cowles, about 1825. He was admitted to the Cleveland bar, and was the last president of the village council. When Cleveland became a city he was mayor and postmaster, state Senator, Representative to Congress, banker, and railroad director.
m. Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, Harriet E. Mather , b. , d. 1887 Washington, District of Columbia.
1 children: Louise.
(8) Louise Allen (John Allen7, Ursula McCurdy6, Ursula Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
m. Fuller , b. , d. .
(6) Ursula McCurdy (Ursula Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 AUG 1778 , d. ABT 1819 .
m. 1815 Erastus Perkins , b. , d. .
(6) John McCurdy (Ursula Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 18 AUG 1780 , d. 23 APR 1785 New London, New London Co., Connecticut.
(5) Matthew Griswold (Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 APR 1760 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 10 JUN 1842 .
NotesMATTHEW was Judge of the Supreme Court of Connecticut.
m. 4 SEP 1788 Lydia Ely , b. 12 SEP 1766 , d. .
(5) Roger Griswold (Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 29 MAR 1762 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 25 OCT 1812 Norwich, New London Co., Connecticut.
NotesROGER graduated from Yale College in 1780 and was admitted to the bar in 1783. In 1794 he was elected to Congress to represent Lyme. He served there for ten years. His fight with Representative Matthew Lyon, which led to a physical fight on the floor of the House of Representatives, created quite a stir. He was offered the post of Secretary of War by John Adams, but declined. In 1807 he was appointed a Judge of the Superior Court, and in 1809 was chosen Lieutenant Governor. He was elected Governor of Connecticut in 1811.
m. 27 OCT 1788 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, Fanny Rogers , b. 23 MAR 1767 Norwich, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 27 DEC 1863 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut.
11 children: Ellen E., Augustus Henry, Charles Chandler, Matthew, Roger Wolcott, Eliza Woodbridge, Mary Ann "Marian", William Frederick, Robert Harper, James, Frances Ann.

NotesAUGUSTUS was a ship's captain.

(8) Grace Card Selden (Lydia Marie Griswold7, Matthew Griswold6, Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 27 OCT 1865 Erie, Erie Co., Pennsylvania, d. .
m. Frederick Lincoln Chapin , b. 1863 Erie, Erie Co., Pennsylvania, d. 9 DEC 1913 .
(7) Matthew Griswold (Matthew Griswold6, Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 6 JUN 1833 Old Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 19 MAY 1919 Erie, Erie Co., Pennsylvania.
NotesMATTHEW moved to Erie, Pennsylvania, in 1865 and formed a partnership with his cousins, John and Samuel Selden, "The Selden and Griswold Manufacturing Co. ", manufacturing iron goods. He bought out the Seldens in 1884. He was a member of the 53rd and 54th Congresses.

6 children: Ursula Wolcott, Adela Sloane, Evelyn, William Edward Schenck, John Sloane, Dwight.
(9) Ursula Wolcott Griswold (William Edward Schenck Griswold8, Matthew Griswold7, Matthew Griswold6, Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 28 JUN 1908 Greenwich, Fairfield Co., Connecticut, d. 11 MAY 1998 Berkeley, Alameda Co., California.
(9) Adela Sloane Griswold (William Edward Schenck Griswold8, Matthew Griswold7, Matthew Griswold6, Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
(9) Evelyn Griswold (William Edward Schenck Griswold8, Matthew Griswold7, Matthew Griswold6, Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 7 JUN 1911 Lenox, Berkshire Co., Massachusetts, d. 3 MAR 1946 .
(9) William Edward Schenck Griswold (William Edward Schenck Griswold8, Matthew Griswold7, Matthew Griswold6, Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 JUL 1912 , d. .
(9) John Sloane Griswold (William Edward Schenck Griswold8, Matthew Griswold7, Matthew Griswold6, Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 26 JUL 1914 Lenox, Berkshire Co., Massachusetts, d. .
NotesJOHN graduated from Yale University in 1937.
He is a etired member of Griswold, Heckel & Kelly Associates, a design and space-planning company and Plaut-Griswold Associates, an international exhibit design group.
He is chairman of the International College at Beirut, Lebanon, chairman and president of the Children's Aid Society of New York, national vice-president of the Boys Club of America, trustee of the Pomfret School and former trustee of Greenwich Country Day School.
During World War II he was W & J Sloane's director of shipbuilding contracts with Newport News Co.
He has served for half a century as a member of the Class Executive Committee and has endowed a scholarship at the Yale School of Forestry and Environmental Studies.

(8) Harold Ely Griswold (William Noyes Griswold7, William Frederick Griswold6, Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 OCT 1870 Of New York City,, New York, d. 1952 .
